name: Mississippi Civil Rights Museum
reviews: Everyone living in or visiting Jackson MS needs to see this incredible museum. It’s good to see Mississippi Civil Rights history next to the national history. No one teaches enough about the unsung hero’s of the movement that made important strides and progress over time. Come here to learn and soak it up!
It was an amazing place. Somewhere to really get connected to what has happened in Mississippi. I highly recommend the experience to everyone, all type of people. We must be aware of our history.

Gorgeous museum. There is so much history, physical history, that I was in awe of. This is a very in depth, long term visit so be prepared. It's a deep, emotionally exhausting journey and should be explored at every point. Please go see this museum. It is absolutely moving.

Very powerful. Very well designed.  Brought my kids here (12 & 13 yrs old) during our 2000 mile road trip through several states.  This was, far and above, the most moving civil rights experience we had.

While I am relatively new to the state of Mississippi, I am quite familiar with the history of the struggles people of color have waged (and continue to wage) for equal rights under the law.  My experience at this museum yesterday afternoon was insightful, educational, inspirational, emotional, angering at times and yet powerful beyond words.  There is simply too much there to internalize in a single visit and I will be going back.  The museum directors have done an exceptional job of organizing a phenomenal collection of local Mississippi knowledge, insights and historical artifacts under one roof in a very impressive facility.  It is difficult to understate the centrality of the state of Mississippi to the experience and history of African Americans in this country.

I also look forward to visiting at some point the other museum right next door to better understand the way the curators may have presented any  intersectionalities among the two collections of historical perspectives.

Additionally, I want to commend the museum staff for being incredibly helpful, friendly and professional.  I stumbled across this museum while out for a Saturday bike ride and since they didn’t have any bike racks on the premises, the security guard was kind enough to allow me to keep my bike in the vestibule while I visited the museum.  (Incidentally, since there are new bike lanes springing up all over downtown Jackson, it appears there is a movement to make the city more bicycle-friendly.  What better way of reinforcing this theme than to have bike racks located at civic institutions all over the city?)

Finally, perhaps my most personal insight from this first visit stems from the recognition that such a museum needed to be created in the first instance—and make no mistake about it, this museum NEEDS to exist.  This reality alone speaks volumes about society’s ongoing ‘three steps forward, two steps back’ approach to progress in fulfilling the original call of the founders for ‘a more perfect union.’

I’m a new fan of this museum and will support it going forward!

name: Mississippi Museum of Natural Science
reviews:
Lovely scientific museum in the center of Jackson, MS!
Lots of unique specimens and dioramas.  I feel in love with the place when I noticed they had one of the best Passenger Pigeon specimens I've ever seen.  
Giant ground sloth?  They got one!
Mastadon skull?  Yep.  Got that, too!
Science and nature lovers will really enjoy this unique place!

Lots of stuff to see out front in their display and aquarium sections.  The behind the seen labs are where the magic is.  I believe they said they had between 2 and 3 million specimens stored on site.  We saw a ton of them and didn't scratch the surface.  Really cool tour.  Thanks to all our MDWFP personnel for all you do to protect and serve our natural resources. Y'all are awesome!

Museum was better than expected. Lots of information about the habitat and wildlife of Mississippi. When my sons and I were there, there was a dinosaur exhibit which was really cool. Live like dinosaurs on the outside with sounds and everything plenty of information and activities (may have to check daily schedule). The Aquarium was tho a few of the exhibits were closed. There was a small gift shop with fair prices.  Also there is a huge playground right outside of the museum area in which you can enjoy once you've paid to enter the park. If its summer months BRING WATER.
Cool aquarium. Lots of free parking. Alligators,turtles, two headed snake and lot of fish. Pretty neat experience only down side not very knowledgeable or interactive staff.
Great place to learn about Mississippi natural resources.  Looking deep into the far reaches of the past to see how Mississippi has come to be and the creatures that once inhabited Mississippi.

name: Mississippi Children's Museum
reviews:
Negatives are: Military discount is only for a specific time frame and the 2nd floor is not accessible for people with strollers easily. 
   I really like the exhibit room and the extra Christmas touches. Perfect for preschool-kindergarten aged. They offer art, music and lots of dramatic play opportunities. The giant Scrabble board is definitely for older children or adults.
So many different things for the kids to enjoy. They can spend a whole day just exploring. Very nice place to take your children.
One of our favourite family spots in the entire state. Extremely well maintained. Worth a visit if you've got kids > 18 months
My kids love coming here. 🤗 so much to do. You get many benefits with being a member! I highly suggest the membership for parents and kids.
Went with my grandchildren and had a blast. The new slide they installed is so much fun. Always have great exhibits and the staff and volunteers really seem to love what they do!!

name: Medgar and Myrlie Evers Home National Monument
address: 2332 Margaret W Alexander Dr, Jackson, MS 39213, USA
reviews: I've been going to Jackson for over 30 years and finally took the the time to stop by and visit this historical sight. The home is well kept. We actually had one of the neighbors come out and share some of his knowledge about this tragic assassination. He was able to point to the spot that the shot was taken. We didn't get to tour the inside because it was pretty early when we stopped by.
My husband and I enjoyed visiting the home of Medgar and Merlie Evers. This visit was very insightful and educational. I would advise everyone to take their children to see this history.
This is a hidden gem in Jackson. It's small and not too overwhelming like the larger museums. It has a nice timeline wall. They could do better with the room setup. But I loved the place.
Excellent  Historical place to visit.  This is in a neighborhood so be courteous when parking.   Be sure not to block driveways and please do not litter.

Gripping oral history of Medgar Evers' ultimate fate and his impact on the Civil Rights movement. Currently it's ran by Tugaloo College but the Parks department is taking over shortly which means it will never be the same. I'd go as soon as possible to get the full experience, otherwise, there will be a tour from a federal agency that has been gutted financially in recent years.

name: Mississippi Museum of Art
address: 380 S Lamar St, Jackson, MS 39201, USA
reviews:
One of the best museum that we have ever visit.
Pros: The place is pretty nice both from the outside and the inside. They are free so it is so amazing and everyone can come and visit that is so awesome. Let me pay the excise be a “special and there’s many activities that you can do while you are there. 
Cons: There’s not a lot of parking space and it is downtown so that may be quite something going on. Because it is free so there’s not many special pictures of arms that you can see.

Yesterday I got to experience an immaculate art exhibit created by Nick Cave and curated by amazing young individuals here in Mississippi. I cannot wait to see what they and the museum has to offer next! This was truly a blessed experience .

The Art Museum is a great place to explore and enjoy exhibits and art work . But I really enjoy the level of service they offer for groups or individuals who choose to rent spaces for special events.
It is absolutely awesome and they offer a variety of menus for every occasion. 
The fees and prices are easy to view on their website. Menu options and request are made after contacting the Museum by phone or email probably.

Came during one of their "Art and Coffee" events, and it was very excellent. The staff makes you feel welcome, the speaker was very interactive and informative while also providing great insight to the history and culture of the pieces presented.

I will be returning for more amusement as well as knowledge. My children enjoyed the variety of art. The one on Medgar Evers was my favorite of all. This is an awesome museum to take your family on a beautiful day.

name: 601 Escape Rooms
reviews: This was a great place. I went on a school trip here and the room was fun. The hints were good and the puzzles were challenging. I liked the hints and how suddenly stuff went out of our expectations. It was really creative and I really enjoyed this place.

I have done 6 or 7 escape rooms in the past few years. This was one of the good ones. We did the prison escape room (I forget the name), and we were successful. There were only three of us, which I think was a good thing, because the room was very linear. That's not a bad thing, not at all. However, I think that if we had had a larger group there would have been some people standing around waiting for something to happen. For three people, it was perfect though. We really enjoyed ourselves! The girl running the show was VERY polite and VERY friendly. We ended up chatting with her for a while after we escaped. All in all, a very good experience, and worth your time if you like escape rooms!

We had so much fun! I can’t wait to do another one! We booked “prison break” and it was so fun! I took three 12 year olds and they were so excited! They needed a lot of help. We escaped with only 1:14 seconds left! The staff is great and very helpful. My only negative is the location and the parking sucks, but as soon as you walk in it’s great! Great setup! It looks like a real set!
Booked the “Lost Cabin” for my daughter’s 16th birthday! We had so much fun trying to escape! One of the best escape rooms we have been to! Thanks for a great time! We will definitely be back!

No words can describe how much fun this was. I have been bragging on this place since July 12th and it's had such a huge impact on how I view the people I went with. Me and my work family/friends did the "Prison Break" room. We all work at a jail so this should  be a breeze we thought.  But oh were we so wrong. It took us working together as a team to escape with just two minutes left. The intensity was at an all time high after thirty minutes had passed. We laughed "ALOT", the staff were so helpful as they helped us with the clues. It was so hilarious and serious at the same time. This would be great for team building. Get you the best group of like minded people you know to enjoy the fun with you. Its going to take all of you to win. Very challenging and exciting.  It's worth  every cent...I can't wait until our next visit. I will go anywhere with the group I was with, because I know we will survive anything together. Have fun...♥️.

name: LeFleur's Bluff State Park
reviews: Traveling to Texas, and found this park a convenient location in Jackson MS. Pulled up to the gate to check in a few minutes after 5. No way to get.  Finally,  someone else leaving the park explained that we had to "go online" and pay and they would email the gate code. Very confusing to say the least. Once we managed to get into the park, we got our campsite and it was a mud hole.   The lake looks like a mud hole too.  But, on the bright side,  we're heading to the outlet mall in Jackson to shop. And we hear that there are some really good places to eat nearby.   Maybe it will get better!

Beautiful place to walk and look at our gorgeous forests and rivers. It's not too hard of a walk, and the paths are pretty decently taken care of, even if they're not long. You wont regret coming to see it!

We love it!! Best place ever--they just reopened after flooding so its a little muddy, but cheap laundry, hot water showers, great fishing, good tv & cell coverage- beautiful place right here in Jackson

Very nice place to walk in shade around thr lake and play on the small playground. Would be nice if there were more biking trails as we have small kids and I didn't really want them on the roads, even with 15mph speed limit. Nice boat ramps to Pearl River. $4 entrance with vehicle. $.50 each person if on foot or bike. Can park at the ballpark next door. Quiet in general and a fair number of folks using the pavilions and camping facilities but not overcrowded on a Saturday. It's great to have this place right in Jackson. They also have trails to the museum area which may allow walking access to the bigger playground and picnic areas there. Will check it out next time. Thanks!
Went the last hour before close. Super clean and we had a blast. Great roadtrip stop.

name: Old Capitol Museum
reviews: Wonderful museum. Free entry. We all learned a lot about history that you can't just learn in books. The kids really enjoyed it. Gentleman at the beginning was super helpful in guiding us the right direction and they had a wonderful map. He also informed us that we could tour the new Capitol building as well. Great place!
Beautiful and free!  Undergoing repairs to exterior now, don't know what else is planned.  Glad Mississippi is preserving it and the history.
Fantastic that this building has been preserved and is continuously being renovated. Great historical site and free!
Enjoyed the history and the views. Free self guided tour. Awesome museum.
Beautifully restored with helpful docents and plenty of exhibits. Definitely worth carving an hour or two out of your day to explore Mississippi history.

name: Mississippi Agriculture and Forestry Museum
reviews: Fantastic for kids. Passionate curators. Lots of hands on activities. Fun family events.

Great place to wander around and see old tractors, buildings, and more. The Fitzgerald collection (medium sized building on the right) was full of arrow heads and great antiques. One of the best buildings in the whole complex.

They had a cotton gin that is said to be the oldest operating cotton gin in the country. Plus, they have a general store. Drinks were expensive but the guy at the counter was really nice and made sure to tell us about some of the interesting buildings that others typically miss.

Overall a great place to visit
My children and I really enjoyed it. It hasn't changed too much since I first seen it as a little girl.

A pleasant place with a nice display of agricultural tools. Outside there is a recreated village with structures from the 19th and early 20th centuries. There are several large model train exhibits that are of interest.

There's an Auditorium for meetings, outside is large area to visit and see Carnival's, Kraft Show's, Food Show's ect. On the Property there's Restaurant with a Lunch Buffet, a General Store & Museum. This is a Very Good place to take Children on a day trip.

name: Museum of Mississippi History
reviews: The Museum of Mississippi History was a great place to visit. There was so many different things to see and experience. Plan to spend more than a couple hours here if you want to see everything. The work and detail put into the exhibits throughout the museum is exceptional.

Very nice museum covering the history of Mississippi. The museum has 2 floor with many different aspects of its history. It begins with the native Americans through the present.  This museum is in the same building as the Civil Rights Museum. There is a free-parking building right next door. There is also a museum store right at the entrance. There is both an elevator and stairs to take you to the second floor. The museum is only a few miles off the interstate so anyone passing through  Jackson should stop by. I would definitely recommend this place to others both young and old.
A Great Presentation of Mississippi History overall. Glad to see a large portion on Native Americans.
Very nice exhibits
Very nice and very informational.

name: Smith Robertson Museum
reviews: So much local history. Loved the pictures!
This is a place Mississippians should definitely visit. It was really detailed and enjoyable. I love learning about MS history especially Black history.
Great place to take the family to find out about African American

This is a place everyone needs to experience! Being a Mississippi native, I can honestly say this was one of the most important discoveries my wife and I made. Full of so much great history and facts.

Any negative reviews are only here to discourage people from learning about the awesome black history that was made in Mississippi.

Please, educate and appreciate.
Great place to visit. Very educational. Friendly environment.  Kids friendly.

name: Eudora Welty House & Garden
reviews: Worth learning about, could learn most about it by a through reading in the welcome center.   Was interesting looking through the house.  $10 tour fee goes to a good cause.
When visiting Jackson you must visit.
went on a school trip here the staff is very nice
Very interesting piece of literature history.
Great writer, great history. Wonderful staff.

name: Mississippi Sports Hall of Fame & Museum
reviews: This was my first stop when I got to Jackson, I'm a huge sports fans and like to enjoy sports museums for states who have them, so this one was a no brainer. When you first open the door you are greeted by an older women and gentlemen, both very nice folks. They have you watch about a 10 minute video on Mississippi sports, very nice short film. At first glance, I was amazed how clean and nice the museum was. As I proceeded to all of the memorabilia, I was expressed on the set up and how much stuff they had on display for all of the different athletes. I highly recommend making this one of your stops when visiting Jackson. You won't be disappointed if you're a sports fan.

This is a fun place to visit. You start your visit with a movie. While entertaining, it is definitely a bit dated now. Clearly over 10 years old and showing its age in my opinion. The staff is super friendly and very enthusiastic about the place. There are many movie clips to watch throughout and you'll see many stars you recognize. The interactive exhibits- namely the one where you can record the call of a big play- are quite fun for everyone.
Went for a birthday party in the community room (I guess that's what it's called). Very nice and roomy!

While I wish it were a bit larger, the exhibits, staff, information, and price are top notch. A great place to spend a day along with the Ag Museum. Events are held here as well. An essential place to visit. 5 Stars!

The facility was very nice and originally would've recieved 5 stars from me. However when I asked about why there wasn't any steve McNair memorabilia. The lady said they a lot it's just not on display because he was murdered, which is why it should be out on display.🙄 also there was  very little in Marcus Dupree & only 1 tiny article on steve McNair both of which were basically tucked away hidden in a closed off section. I feel like peoples personal biases and opinions should not overshadow what these missiapians talents and legacies. I was considering purchasing a lifetime membership but after that talk I was turned off & probably won't return. Which is unfortunate because the facility it very nice

name: Governor's Mansion
address: 300 E Capitol St, Jackson, MS 39201, USA
reviews: Great architecture from the outside. I wish we were able to explore the inside!
Beautiful grounds - enjoyed this lovely nativity scene.  Walk around and get a sense of the rich history.
Very much a sense of depth in history, in that magical way only being starstruck can give you. Being there makes you feel like you somehow own a little piece, that you could belong there.

Beautiful home. Great hostess. Ms. Debra Bryant invited us to walk through the home and allowed us to view all rooms. Pimento and cheese sandwiches were the best. Tuna sandwiches are second to none. Homemade for sure. Chocolate chip cookies, oh my goodness.
Beautifully decorated for Christmas. The Bryants were very gracious.

name: The Oaks House Museum
address: 823 N Jefferson St, Jackson, MS 39202, USA
reviews: Nice historical house. Pleasant tour guide. Bring cash for fee.
Did not go in but looks great!
Great tour guide. Interesting yo see what it was like so long ago
Great history!
Gardens are a delight.

name: The Jackson Zoological Park
address: 2918 W Capitol St, Jackson, MS 39209, USA
reviews:
Disappointing to see a Zoo run down. The girl who took our money was not the 'face of the zoo I was expecting - sullen. As a veteran I was entitled to a cheap entry rate. I didn't ask for it because it was obvious even before we went through the gate the Zoo was run down and that they need the money.

Most of the animals looked depressed. The giraffe walked around in circles while the Asian bear struggled to breathe. Some of the enclosures were so antiquated they were falling apart.

We came to Jackson Zoo for a quick stop over and to be honest we couldn't wait to leave. I know that's harsh, but the presentation of the zoo has a lot to be desired.

Come on Mississippi you can do better than that! It's clear your city leaders are failing you and with elections coming up demand action to fix your Zoo.

I wish it was more donations rolling in to get the zoo back to its thriving days. It needs some upkeep for sure but the animals are pure joy. I enjoyed seeing the giraffe and I loved that tut the ostrich walks along the wall following you. He's cute. I enjoyed the zoo overall.

The animals aren't doing so good and parts of the park is closed due to insufficient finances.  A lot of things are over grown and broken down. It would be a great idea for them to allow volunteers from churches to help out and clean up things

Pretty nice smaller zoo.  It's apparent that they care for their animals.   Enclosures were clean and the animals looked to be in good health.   Large portions of the zoo were off limits and dilapidated. Entire buildings collapsing right as you come in to zoo.  It's really got a ton of potential, but it's pretty run down.  I'll bet In it's day,  this was a wonderful zoo.

It looked like the zoo was on the upswing when I moved here in 2015. Sadly, when I went last week, it was more dilapidated than ever. The animals seemed depressed and lethargic. Many of them weren’t even in their exhibits. Buildings are falling in. The staff seems unengaged. We really can do better. It’s time for our community to pitch in and overhaul the zoo if we want to keep it.

name: Mynelle Gardens Arboretum & Botanical Center
reviews: Stopped by to kill some time and was pleasantly surprised at how nice this place is. Very beautiful garden and peaceful to sit or take a stroll. They have food for feeding the fish in the pond with two arch bridges and a pretty fountain. Beautiful areas for events. I give 4 instead of five stars because although so beautiful and peaceful the landscaping is under renovation in some areas. I asked about this and they are owned by the city and lacking funding. With more public support this place has high potential to be a jewel in the rough in this city.

5.00 per person is too much for this small garden. The garden is not very well cared for and needs a lot of work. Same for the house, it was basically used as storage, such a shame too because it's such a beautiful house.
Love this place! Needs some additional funding it seems to restore it to its past glory!but it's still nice

Needs to be Renovated. The up keep is poor. Not alot of visitors. For years I didn't even know what this place was. This was my first visit. I thought it would be a nice place to take pictures. It was okay.
This is the place for a great reception, engagement, baby shower, or wedding! Nothing huge but wow what a view and what a feeling!!

name: Cathead Distillery
address: 422 S Farish St, Jackson, MS 39201, USA
reviews: Very nice distillery. It's great that it's family friendly and all the games on the tables make it fun for the kids as well as the adults. The tour was good and the tasting was nice. It's a shame that you don't get the souvineer glass like you used to. Good selection of beers as well.

I had read some reviews and wanted to come by and check it out since they allowed pups. Upon arrival we really were taken back by the space as the decor was awesome! We grabbed a beer and found out due to MS laws that they couldn't sell mixed drinks on property but they did have tours where we can taste. So after a short wait until the next tour we had a great walk through with Zack and ended with some tastings. My wife and I enjoyed the vodka and bourbon (we aren't gin fans). After the tour I stopped by the gift shop for a hat and a bottle of bourbon for home since not distributed in Ohio as of yet. If I'm ever back in the area I will def be stopping back by!
All the tasty things are made here. Hoodoo is amazing and vodka is tasty straight

We went the day after Christmas and it was pretty empty, but that didn't stop Taylor from giving us her attention on a personal tour and tasting. The gin is amazing and the vodkas are great too. My bf really liked the bourbon, and we both raved about the chicory liquor. A super cool spot with good booze. Too bad they can't serve drinks there too. I bet the music festival is pretty awesome! #SupportLiveMusic
We came for the yoga. Stayed for the tour and the tasting. Everything was excellent!

name: Cathedral of St. Peter
address: 123 N West St, Jackson, MS 39201, USA
reviews: Best church I have went to it's big and everyone is very helpful
A beautiful Cathedral of the Diocese of Jackson, it is a very beautiful church and very nice tour organized by the Diocesan Archivist.
I loved the ornate beauty and ambience of this church. Very welcoming place of worship.
A church is a church is a church. But I would say this I believe is one of the oldest churches in the city if not the state. It is located in a very historic part of downtown.

I would like to respond to the wedding photographer who “could not do their job” because they were not allowed in the sanctuary during the wedding ceremony. 

Weddings are not events purely for the ‘show’. This is a sacrament that Catholics take seriously. In the past when photographers were allowed in during the ceremony, they have been know to stand on the side altars, wander all around the main altar during Mass, or even asked to have the altar removed to allow more room ... all of which is totally disrespectful and does not allow the priest to “do his job.”

The best pictures are taken prior to the wedding, and believe it or not, some nice photos can be taken ‘through the glass’ on the vestibule doors. I know this for a fact ... because of my own sons wedding.

The Cathedral is a very beautiful and welcoming church.

name: Enter/Locked Escape Rooms
address: 6718 Old Canton Rd, Ridgeland, MS 39157, USA
reviews: This was so much fun! We played The Cleaners - it was challenging, but not so hard that we couldn't figure it out. The room was so well built. They did a great job with all the details - very realistic. There's also a major twist in the game, but I don't want to give anything away! The staff was professional and knowledgeable - they knew right when we needed help. This is a great way to spend an hour with friends!

I've done escape rooms in Las Vegas and Los Angeles, and this room was every bit as well produced and run as any I've seen. The puzzles were fun and inventive, the room was laid out very well, and the production values were fantastic. 

Our guide Ashton was very friendly and helpful, and ran the room expertly. I'm not from the area, but next time I'm in town visiting I'll definitely suggest Enter/Locked as a great place for a family outing.

My husband and I have played all of the escape rooms at Enter/Locked and they have all been a blast! They're fun, challenging, innovative, and completely original because the owners come up with the rooms themselves.  The staff was super nice and helpful before, during, and after our game, as well.  On this particular visit, we brought some newbie friends to play The Cleaners with us and everyone left so impressed! It's such a great activity to engage in with family &/or friends because it requires attention and teamwork (unlike a movie, etc.).

My first escape room experience was excellent! What a great idea for a Christmas present for the family. Our group of five was perfect for the Murder Motel. The puzzles were pretty challenging for a novice but two in the group had previous escape room experience which was very helpful. We solved in near record time!

...Our church group is scheduled to go in a month. We stopped in to get group pricing and a tour.The owner Pauline was so wonderful and very helpful. She helped us decide what level of challenges would be a fit for our group and gave us a peek at one of the rooms.
The facility is extremely modern with a streamlined appeal.computerized signin and convenient secure parking.
Everything about Escape Room is well planned and thought out.
There are different levels of and games within the game.
The room we viewed was awesome and the owners skillfully crafted and designed it themselves...they should probably be designing for theme parks or movie sets...it's just that good.
We can't wait for our trip. Groups of 10 or greater get the best discounts.
Visit their website...call them or stop by.it's better to make an appointment for the drop in visit. But the owner is wonderfully nice.

name: Two Mississippi Museums
reviews: We just had our daughters wedding at the Two Museums and the venue was perfect.

Visited both museums.  Interesting facts about Mississippi through the years. The Civil Rights museum told a dark history of Mississippi.  It's a must see. Be prepared to spend a few hours taking it all in.
Great history, great staff
I salute the staff on their professionalism, courtesy and knowledge. I especially salute Pam Junior for choosing high caliber staff and volunteers. Everyone must visit...
Visited for a TEDxJXN conference. The facility is beautiful and should make every Mississippian proud to have such a building dedicated to telling our story.

name: Russell C Davis Planetarium
address: 201 E Pascagoula St, Jackson, MS 39201, USA
reviews: You are better off going to a middle school science fair.

Like other reviewers, I have to say this place is in sore need for updating and it's a crying shame that the city doesn't support this adequately. That said, our Grandkid's Spring Break was different from the local schools and we were the only one's there, but the staff treated us royally and turned what could have been an awful experience (because of a car-sick kid) into a fun, unique outing.

My family and I drove several hours on a Saturday to come here. I parked and fed the meter some quarters, but was later told the meters don't need to be fed on weekends, but I can't confirm that. Come prepared with a roll of quarters. I'd rather come back out to a car for $2.00 than to discover it's been towed. 

As with anywhere, be mindful of your surroundings and lock your car doors etc. We did see several drifters and drunks in the area, so just be cautious. I wouldn't leave anything in plain sight inside the car. Put it in the trunk or take it with you. 

If you prefer stairs to elevators like I do, the stairs are located in an outside support "leg" of the building. They look like narrow brick columns with doors. Open the door and be prepared to climb to the third floor. My husband found the elevator in the opposite leg across the street from each other. A security guard inside the glass doors of the main building had to radio for staff to come unlock the stairwell for me. They were very kind about it though.

Restrooms are on the 3rd floor, as well as some water fountains in a back hallway. The restrooms are in desperate need of repair and I did not see a baby changing station. I can't confirm if the water fountains even worked, but there is nothing to buy to eat or drink here, so bring your own snacks for children or those with medical needs.  

There are some mostly empty glass display cases where you'll pay admission fees. Cash only, no credit cards. I didn't see an ATM. $8.00 for adults, $7.00 for seniors, $6.00 for small children, and **that's for each movie you want to see**. There are currently three different films and they last about 40 minutes each. Younger children will likely only care for one of the three at this time. Call ahead and ask questions. 

As far as a planetarium, I was expecting to relax and watch stars for awhile to a different degree than was shown. I have a high school student taking Astronomy and this was the main reason for our visit. 

There is nothing else to do here, but see a few pictures on the wall and sit and wait for the next film to start. There are a few old educational displays that are not plugged in or lit up, an unused popcorn machine and an empty Coca-Cola cooler. There are a few dollar store quality toy items for sale inside the display cases. I would just bring some glow necklaces and bracelets from the dollar store and surprise the kids with them and a Moon Pie or pack of space ice cream when you arrive. 

The best seats for viewing are the back rows. I am sensitive to movement, so there were a few segments in the films that made me feel like the room was spinning around slowly like a carousel or like the entire floor was turning upside down, slowly to the right, but I'm sure not everyone is that sensitive to notice. 

Some of the other reviews mention broken seats which we did see. The seat backs are tilted back at an angle but are not recliners. There are arm rests between all the seats, that don't move, so these would not accommodate larger visitors. Think of old, narrow movie theater or auditorium seats. We also found alot of wooden sticks from eaten rock candy lollipops on the floor. My husband said the theater smelled musty to him.

The staff here is very friendly and can help you find other things to see in the area. Educators can call for field trip packets and information.

The Russel C. Davis Planetarium is one of two planetarium statewide. It is located in downtown Jackson and is dedicated to imparting knowledge about space earth the environment the human body and the sciences in general. For those who don't know the domed ceiling is used as a screen and movies about various subjects are projected there. The movies generally take you to the place described for instance space or inside the human body. If you're in town with kids this may be a fun distraction. If you are local and happen to never have been you definitely should go.
I take my grand children there at least once a year. It is very entertaining and informative.

name: Winners Circle Park
reviews:
Great place to stretch your legs, play tennis, or let your kids play. 
I discovered this place by accident.  It is a real gem in the middle of the concrete jungle.  It has a sidewalk walking trail which has some various exercise stops along the route. Many tennis courts. Barbecue grill with benches under pavilions that you can reserve.  And it has playgrounds for various ages.  
Parking is good and it has clean rest rooms.  Well maintained. It is a nice break for being in the city.

Great place to hang out, exercise or just play with your kids. A really nice walking trail, amphitheatre, kids play equipment, covered picnic tables, and restrooms. Very well maintained and very popular with the locals. If you need a little free exercise, this is your perfect  destination.

An amazing park, very well kept. And the rubber surface is very forgiving for my overly confident toddler. Can be very busy at times but if you go earlier in the day you can have the place almost to yourself.
We loved this park....   it was clean well kept.  The playground didn't have broken equipment or anything. The kids and ourselves had lots of fun...
Beautiful, clean park with soft surfaces so children don't hurt themselves if they fall while running and playing.  Lots of shaded areas.

name: Parham Bridges' Park
address: 5055 Old Canton Rd, Jackson, MS 39211, USA
reviews: GOD IS GOOD. GOD BLESS. GOD PROVIDES. PHILIPPIANS 4:19.    "CLEAN and a RELAXING place to be at." THANK GOD. TO GOD BE THE GLORY FOR EVER AND EVER AMEN. HALLELUJAH 🙌 PRAISE HIS HOLY NAME.
Nice walking trail. Just be aware and alert of your surroundings. High crime area. If are a female don't go to far on trail by yourself. It looked a bit dicey.

This place a great for family walking as well as individual physical fitness. This location also have outdoor equipment. This has been added since my last visit. Great alternative to joining a gym that you will never have time to visit.
If you need to take a walk and get rid of some anger, this is the perfect place. I've been coming here for years and it's still the same.  The whole track is 1 mile long and it's not boring.
Nice spot for an outside workout, walk, run! One of the nice parks in this area.

name: International Museum of Muslim Cultures
address: 201 E Pascagoula St, Jackson, MS 39201, USA
reviews: Such a treat to find this museum, and in Mississippi of all places! Right now they are in the process of slowly moving to a new location.  You can see an exhibit on manuscripts from Timbuktu that date back to the middle ages at one of the MS Museum of art  complex buildings. The new location on Capitol Street is where the introductory exhibits are located. Both spaces are only a few short blocks from each other.
Excellent docents, well researched interpretation and attractive displays. A great museum to visit to learn history that isn't taught in school!
Friendly staff. Very educational. Glad that I visited.
It was wonderful to get together with the ummah today,  it was a privilege to sit amongst such knowledge and wisdom today at our company meeting...All praises and thanks to The Creator!

Very educational museum with exhibits on Islamic Moorish Spain, on Timbuktu, Mali (Africa), and a new exhibit on coexistance and the similarities with Christianity and Judaism... An amazing museum to visit!

name: Battlefield Park
address: 953 W Porter St, Jackson, MS 39204, USA
reviews: Pleasent and clean. I enjoy having a place like this to retreat from the city environment. I'd love to manage a park like this. The park is well maintained, but as a lover of such areas there are a few things I'd do to improve it. The staff i encountered was a bit rude, but I enjoyed myself.
Beautiful place. Environment was good. View was awesome.
Big n has plenty of stuff for kids to play on. Basketball and baseball. Tennis courts n huge running area.
I love going there we have our familt reunion there every year
Clean park with lots of space and many structures for kids to play

name: Flowood Nature Park
reviews: An extension of the kids park. I went for MD walk for my grandson and loved the view ( and the exercise). Only complaint was the bathroom stalls didn't all have tissue ( only 1 did). Park was clean and safe. Recommend checking it out!
Very nice park with a great walking trail. First time here and will revisit soon. Great for photos and walking with your family.

My wife and two of my kids actually drove all the way to Florence to check out the Flowood Nature Park on a Sunday afternoon. It was lovely...like a little Sanctuary in the middle of a sprawling metropolis. Reminded me a little -- A LITTLE -- of St. James park from our trip to the UK last year. Seriously, it's a very nice park and apparently very conducive to dogs (we have four but didn't bring any). Highly recommended.

This park has a very nice nature walk! Has several benches along with multiple roofed picnic tables if you wanted to bring your family to eat or just come with a bite yourself, also has a place to grill! Really is a great park in a good location. I am thankful for all the companies sponsoring this location. Would recommend visiting!
A lovely nature park with beautiful scenery! I enjoy it every time I visit

name: Crystal Lake
reviews: I love crystal lake. Quiet. Low traffic. Beautiful. Kayaking here is perfect. Flowood PD drives through regularly.
Its a quick fishing spot. Hard fishing to test your skills

This is a good place to kayak and a good place to fish. There are some great views of wildlife, including but not limited to foxes and alligators, here if you know where to look. The parking is great and bathroom facilities are available. There is a fishing pier as well. I have met a lot of friendly people here. Its a great place to get away to for a day.
Nice quiet place. Some pretty good fishing.
I love crystal lake. Quiet. Low traffic. Beautiful. Kayaking here is perfect. Flowood PD drives through regularly.

name: Manship House Museum
address: 420 E Fortification St, Jackson, MS 39202, USA
reviews: Excellent guides. Period music a wonderful touch. Engaging

name: Natchez Trace Multi-Use Trail
reviews: The scenery is peaceful.  The trail is paved, so ideal for running and biking.  Very clean.
Nice trail along the natchez trace, section near the reservoir overlook is almost always shaded so its a nice place to walk even in the late morning or afternoon
Historical marker along the highway that actually has a small parking lot.  You could park and actually read the information.  Nice idea.

I take my boys biking and scootering while I rollerblade or run on this paved trail for miles. It is well traveled and safe during the day and there are benches and water fountains along the way. The rice road parking area or reservoir overlook are good places to park. Stop at the craft center! 😊
You have to see this place in person.

name: Freedom Ridge
address: 253 W School St, Ridgeland, MS 39157, USA
reviews: The playground is a lifesaver when you have small children and you still want to be close enough to watch the game!
Great park, huge, lakeside. Shade!
Great Ball Park and up to Date with all your favorite Ball Park needs. Great Staff and Umpires.
Lots of soccer and softball fields. There is a wonderful shaded trail back behind the softball fields with a little pond.
It's a good large playground for kids and adults too. There's a nice pavilion to have meetings, gatherings, reunions, and entertainment.

name: Brighton Park
address: S, 530 Brighton Dr, Clinton, MS 39056, USA
reviews: So glad to have this facility in Clinton! Excited for the many upgrades the city has planned!
Great place for the kids. Something for all of them
Fin place to take children to play if over 5. 1/2 mile walking trail, does get boring if you want to walk several miles. The area is clean and safe.
Great place to relax, get some exercise, play tennis, frisbee golf. Super clean and free.

Always great to take your kids for a family outing! It's always clean, I put my bike on the bike rack on my truck, pack up snacks and beverages and we enjoy our outdoors time especially around this time of year when it cools down and it's not as hot

name: Old Trace Park
reviews: The seagulls are beautiful to watch as they fly over your head and dive for the food that you give them. Gods  creatures can be so beautiful if you know how to appreciate them.

The family and I enjoyed our picnic the tables and seating were clean but I still put down a tablecloth and covered the seats. The view was spectacular, atmosphere was peaceful. This was my second trip there this month, I found a nice clean and safe park for my family.
Relaxing, by the water, picnic tables, walking trails and play park.

One of the most beautiful park I have seen. Don't have enough words to describe it. It has everyyhinh u ask for..from picnic tables to boat ramp.beautiful sunset and windy wavy water....nice place to jog...huge place for kids to play around...dogs park and most importantanty it's clean and safe. Always love coming here...
Had a fun time there. Nice sunny with the views and bugs. Be aware you would have to pay $5 if you try to park in the main entrance. I parked on the side and walked.

name: Mississippi Petrified Forest
address: 124 Forest Park Rd, Flora, MS 39071, USA
reviews: We stayed in the campground. I guess they had a lot of rain and we were unable to hook up to the sewer without sinking our camper in the mud. We were not permitted to look for a campsite before registering otherwise we would not have stayed. Because of the condition of the campsite and shower house, we did not pay extra to tour the forest. It was ok for a night or two quick stay but would not recommend it for any longer.
Very nice place! Friendly and helpful employees. The gift shop has so many very beautiful items and gifts. Highly recommended!!
The 1/2 mi trail isn't worth the entrance fee. Do yourself a favor and read a book/use online resource. Gift shop is cool

An interesting piece of natural history. This attraction is privately owned and the owners are dedicated to returning the land to its original state (farming exposed the fossils). Why bother having a museum and nature trail, if you don't want people to see the logs in 50 years? $$$

 If you put up a fence around a bunch of petrified logs, charged people money to walk on a trail and look at said logs, and then were unfriendly, you would have copied the business model here. Hate to say it, but this gem is not worth the price of admission.
Went not expecting much but I LOVED it.  The forest is beautiful and the museum and shop are so awesome.  They have the most amazing fossils I've seen in the museum

name: Sweet Olive Tour Boat
reviews: First off this is a very laid back & relaxing boat tour of the Barnett Reservoir. Although it was a hot afternoon in June when we went, surprisingly the boat is open enough to keep you at least comfortable and somewhat cool. The boat has seating with or without tables and there is good music playing. They offer free drinks (either water or soda) while on the tour. The tour is about 1.5hrs. You go about 45 minutes out and then back.There were only 2 other groups on the tour the day we went so it wasn't crowded.  We sat up front and the captain was very nice, and informative. He gave a thorough history lesson about the reservoir and the surrounding areas. I would definitely recommend this tour to anyone in the area especially if you want to relax and learn about the area.
A very nice ride for an hour. very scenic, calm and refreshing.  Jason who owns the boat is very friendly and shared a great deal of knowledge. Must go and have the experience for your self.

The boat ride was pleasant.  However, we were invaded by millions of mosquitoes which made for an unpleasant experience.   This is no fault of Sweet Olive, it's just nature.  Perhaps they can devise a way to keep out the mosquitoes.
I just seen it passed by when fishing on my dad's boat

I invited my friends and family for a cruise on the Sweet Olive in June.  It was so beautiful and relaxing on the Rez that three weeks later two of us returned for a second cruise. The boat is clean and comfortable, the music is nice and Captain Jason is so gracious.  The hospitality is unbeatable. The next time you see the Sweet Olive Boat passing by, just wave to it because I just might be on my THIRD cruise waving back to you.  We loved it!

name: Richland Eastside Park
reviews: Great Park and well kept. The ONLY issue there is currently is that the Tennis court lights are set to shut off TOO EARLY.   The court sign says they are open until 10:00 PM but the lights shut off around 8:45 PM and you're not able to turn them back on.  It'd be great to be able to play at night when it's cooler especially during the summer months.
Love to take my Grandbabies  there
Nice walking trail, tennis courts, soccer, playground for younger children
Very nice park for children and adults to spend some memories together
Grandchildren love this park

name: Pelahatchie Shore Park
reviews: Great spot for morning sunrise. There is a disk golf corse, easy walking access to the beach, Kayak launch ramp that is ADA, picnic tables, and plenty of areas for the dogs to play.
Definitely not the best place to fish. However, my husband did catch a bass using a purple worn. There is a perfect area  to "picnic" and for small children - the water is only about 3'- 4' deep.

A charming, tranquil little park on the Ross Barnett Reservoir to visit for some reflective relaxation, stop over for a quiet yet scenic snack break on an otherwise hectic workday in order to decompress, or even engage in numerous small-scale activities or leisure exploration. It's not always about the "size" or "popularity" of any given park, and if you are looking for an easily-accessible rustic surrounding to immerse yourself in, then it's the smaller, less-touristy, less-crowded nature spots which can turn out to be the most magical and rejuvinating.
Fun and challenging disc golf course here. A long 18 holes. The baskets are regularly moved between three different spots on most holes.
We had a great time here!

name: Richland Westside Park
reviews: Great park for 6 and up. Big kids loved it. Not much to do for little ones.
Good place to take kids for a little afternoon fun.
Wonderful city park playground. New, safe, state-of-the-art equipment. Best attraction is the zipline, which my children enjoyed, and maybe we parents did too!
Nice little park in town with great ballfields and even the fire station next door. The kids loved the playground.  Police presence was nice to see.  Thanks, Richland!
The playground is new and my 4 year old granddaughter loves it

name: City of Jackson Fire Museum
address: 355 W Woodrow Wilson Ave, Jackson, MS 39213, USA
reviews: What a great museum. A real gem inside the city.
I went down the fire pole, it was so much fun!  Hooray!
The students really enjoyed it here!

This is a local fire station that also doubles as a fire safety and fire station history museum. It is open to the public though i do believe the majority of their museum traffic is school related trips. It is a very fun and interesting museum though.
Was not open. No one to ask. Doors locked. No sign at back door.

name: Cypress Swamp
address: Natchez Trace Pkwy, Canton, MS 39046, USA
reviews: Very beautiful place, although shorter than I expected. The whole thing could be walked in fifteen minutes, but taking it slow will give you time to traverse and take photos. Great place to walk your dog, kids may enjoy exploring the area. Little fish can be seen swimming in the shallow water, while crickets chirp. Definitely recommend going

Was pretty cool. Short walk around little swamp and the cypress and tupelo trees.  There are mosquitoes so be warned. No other wildlife except a squirrel.  But the next stop up there was an alligator in the river.
Beautiful little side trail. Just remember IT'S A SWAMP. What lives in swamps? SKEETERS! Big black ones. Remember the Skeeter spray!

Quiet little stroll through a beautiful still water area! Best time to go is in cooler months to avoid mosquitos, but if you wanna see the gators, go when it's warmer and later in the day. And be sure you bring plenty of skeeter dope or you'll surely be scratching yourself silly half a mile down the road!! 😂😂😂
Loved visiting this place! The reflection water is wondrous. Be careful not to fall in! I highly recommend coming here!

name: Jamie Fowler Boyll Park
reviews: The landscape is fantastic. Always neat and clean
Location of WellsFest and other fun events in town. It's a little oasis of nature on the edge of Jackson.
Beautiful!
Very nice place to carry your family
Very outdated.  Needs to be tended too.

name: King Edwards Apartments
address: 102 N Mill St, Jackson, MS 39201, USA
reviews:
Good morning,

I am extremely disturbed and offended. I frequent the city of Jackson. This is my second time in less the 45 days of being at your property.

This morning I came off of the elevator at 3:48am to await my driver. Noticing my driver had not yet arrived I decided to sit in the lobby to wait.  A few minutes later I’m approached by your hotel security guard being asked forcefully “hey, do you have a room here.” I looked at him and sir, don’t bother me.” He said “listen here if you don’t have a room here you can sit in here.”

Mind you, I’m sitting in the lobby with $7000 worth of Louis Vuitton luggage on, a $500 Robert graham shirt, $200 jeans and $300 Robert graham shoes. I am obviously no transient vagabond looking for a place to duck out of the cold.

The security noticed I was not going to accept being harassed without resistance said “I’m just telling you what she told me.” I asked “who is she”, he pointed towards the front. I then said tell her don’t bother me either. He continues to persist that I needed to leave. So I proceed to walk over to where “she was.” She is your night auditor Shonda; who is seated 40 feet from the elevator outside of your business center with her feet kicked up on a chair wrapped in a blanket watching TV. She is 40 feet from the same elevators I had just come off of. Had she not been so consumed in her television show she would have both heard and seen me come off of the elevator. I walked over to her and demanded her name and told her that the way she was seated over there the question should be asked is she a guest or is she working. She proceeded to demonstrate her contempt by jumping up and and grabbing a business card to hand to me.

A white guest came off of the same elevator and was greeted with great kindness. Another white guest walked in off the street  with slippers and a robe on and a coffee mug in hand and was greeted with great kindness. But the black man is harassed, and disrespected.

It is disgusting that such blatant displays of racism are still apart of the American reality. Especially from one black person to another.

I sent my complaint in, tangent manager responded promising to call me but never did.

If you’re a person of color this may not be the hotel for you.

Sincerely, a disgusted customer
Small apartments for small people. The ceilings are like 4 inches from the floor. But they have a cool kitchen. And clean carpet.

I currently live in the King Edwards.   I have the small one bedroom on the 12th floor I rented without visiting first due to being from out of town.  First of all the personnel Danielle M was so helpful with the application, questions etc.  Security guard, Parks was helpful ! .  I met Molly last week.   Molly is nothing but pure energy, delight .   She is a resource for things to do or where to go in Jackson.   She definitely knows what is going on downtown in the community and around the area.   The apartments are very nice.   I wish that they kept the stairways cleaner and the trash swept up outside.   I have noticed taking the stairs that the janitor or the repairman have left equipment, trash on the stairwells in between floors.   I love the rooftop and the little pool.   The workout room is nice along with community room.   The whole floor is quiet!    They have apartments on the 9, 10, 11, and 12th floor.  You do have to pay for your electric and internet .  Also parking is 75.00 dollars a month for covered in the garage but it’s worth it!!   You have keyed entry so your secure.  I love it.  Mailbox is downstairs.
Beautiful lobby, but the rooms were rather small, plus you has to pay for parking
These are the apartments located in the mixed usage King Edward Hotel. This hotel is a historic Jackson hotel which has been remodeled and repurposed to become a useful part of the community again.

name: Dr. Reed B. Hogan, MD
reviews: The procedure was easy. I did not experience any discomfort or pain. I would recommend others to just do it, you won't regret having it done. The staff is very professional and pleasant.  Thanks for treating me well!

What impressed me more than anything was the fact that my doctor remembered exactly something that I said during our last meeting three months ago.  I realize that there has to have been a large number of patients seen by this doctor since then.  What the doctor remembered proved to me that I was truly being listened to and cared for.

ONE EXCELLENT AND ALMOST NO AREAS WHERE I HAVE ANY PROBLEMS. Waiting in the waiting room  was the only area. 
The other areas as waiting and changing out into gown and the entire rest of the areas were performance by nothing very polite professions. I had no entirely no places where people were nothing bit polite and profession treatment
 Sirs and mam's I was totally impressed in the whole process. Thank you for great process of my treatment at gi associates on 12/16/19
Thank you Dr. Hogan, this was my 2nd colonoscopy with you. All went well both times. I appreciate your expertise. Everyone treated me so nice and they were all so kind. Keep up the good work!

Nice facility. Very nice personnel from the check-in desk to the procedure room and every step in between.  Dr. Hogan has performed various GI procedures for me over the years. He is always very professional, very caring, and is never rushed. He is thorough in his questions before any procedure and makes sure you understand the results afterwards. He genuinely cares about the health of his patients.

name: Vicksburg National Military Park
reviews: My husband and I take or grandchildren there.  They love this place.  They get lots of exercise and history lessons, as well as high quality together time.  Also an awesome place to walk in the evening.  If you time it just right and begin walking back to your car just before dusk, you will see numerous deer.  Bucks of all sizes hang together then does of all sizes hang together.  Sometimes they’re intermingled.  But to easily see 35 is putting a conservative number on it.  If you love wildlife, it’s definitely a place to go walk.

What an experience!! There is so much to see, You will need a good 4 to 5 hours at least. So many monuments and history here. It really is so cool having history preserved and explained so well. Start off in the visitor center and catch the quick free movie on Vicksburg,  then drive through the park.

Great, fascinating National Military Park. Wonderful movie with lots of great background for those like me whose school education covered the Civil War in its entirety in about a week.

Volunteers Roger and Connie are wonderful. Roger knows a ton about the Military history and enthusiastically shares it in the depth appropriate to his audience. Connie knows the military but also the stories of area residents and the human history of living through such a lengthy siege. 

Roads are well marked with markers explaining troop positions and strategies. One of the best parts, though, is all the monuments donated by states, societies, and families to commemorate their troops, family members, and contributions to this battle. Some monuments were very ornate and impressive. Others were of a simpler design but equally impressive in their quiet, subdued way. 

Blue signs mark the Union positions and red mark the Confederates. History is always interpreted by the winner, so the slant is more Union, but it is nice to see the story of the Confederacy included in a factual, respectful way!

I wish I had more time to walk the trails and see more of the areas on foot, as a soldier did over 150 years ago. (It's an amazing difference to see it from the ground on foot rather than your car. The roads are built to provide a higher vantage point. Trust me:  get out and walk around.)

I liked starting the experience with the video in the Visitor's Center. It helped a lot with giving a full overview so that I could appreciate the driving tour through the park better. So I would recommend starting there.

I also recommend visiting the Cairo Museum. I found seeing the boat especially interesting.

An outstanding place to visit. The somber atmosphere will cause deep contemplation and gratitude for soldiers on both sides of the war. A really enriching place to visit. The entrance for vehicles closes early, but it's a beautiful place for an evening or early morning walk. The park hosts events periodically for patriotic events. They also do somewhat of a live reenactment complete with cannon fire.

name: USS Cairo Museum
reviews: What an amazing National Park, spent the day here with my Jr. Ranger and my family, could have spent a week wandering this entire park. Such an amazingly thought out Park, the monuments and drivable tour was a perfect experience for everyone. Its mindblowing that so many had to lose their life over such a simple solution to the end of slavery, a very powerful experience for sure and a great place to road school your kids!
A piece of history that most will never see. The museum, itself, is small but the Cairo remains are truly impressive. I highly recommend.

The restoration and presentation of this civil war battleship is spectacular from bow to stern. The ship is beautiful in itself, but the architecture of the museum and the exhibits in it are unique and informative also.

Any visit to Vicksburg national military Park should include a walk around one of the amazing ironclads that were in service turn the civil war. The national Park service has done a great job in restoring this sunken ironclad that was one of the vessels so important to the union victory at Vicksburg.  Being able to walk through it and around it was very impactful, and gave me the sense of what it was like to be a sailor on the vessel...

Great artifacts, great layout, and knowledgeable staff on site. The history of the ship is so interesting. Take your time while you're here and ask the guides a lot of questions. They're glad to talk about the battles, the ship's history, and it's preservation.

name: Bill Vance Park
address: 120 Golden Estates Dr, Brandon, MS 39042, USA
reviews: Awesome park
Great place to walk or run and great for the kiddos felt so safe!!
How do u know I was even there?  Anyway  I love it.  I'm there  almost every day . Don't  tell anyone, but with my dog. Reminds me of paradise. No I wasn't  there. I'm old, but I'm not Adam.
Nice quiet place to walk or jog.  Playground equipment for the kids and picnic tables.   No water or restrooms keeps it from five stars.
Peaceful clean

name: Roosevelt State Park
reviews: Wonderful trails! There's a great family of beavers that live on the back end of Shadow Lake and they have an amazing set of tunnels going into their dams. We stayed in the cabins and will be back to enjoy the views again in June! Thank you so much for the wonderful time and the clean cabin. I haven't been able to just relax with my husband in SO long and we definitely needed this. Support your parks!

This Park is Really Nice have so many amenities that you will not believe can find on a Forest Park the list is so big let see they have 6 Natural Trails, Huge Lake named Shadow Lake, have 109 sites for RV Camping, Primitive Camping Area, 4 Pavilions, Like 13 Cabins, They Have a Motel with many room's and all have windows to the lake, Boat Ramp, many Bathhouse all around the Park, they have a Water Slide and Pool, Fishing, Disc Golf, Playground, Alfreda Harris Lodge, Livingston Performing Arts Center, Ballfield & Tenis Court, Conference Room, Video Games, Pool Tables and many other things that I will not finish if continue so if have the Time Come and Visit also the Observation Tower outside on the Hill if is close ask and they opened for you. Enjoy and Love the Nature.

The lake and scenery are beautiful, but the park is desperately in need of TLC. We were disappointed to see the lookout tower closed, vandalism in several places, worn out structures and fallen trees everywhere. It looks like they are operating on a tiny budget and what was once a magnificent resort-type retreat in now dilapidated and sad. The tennis court is overgrown, wood rot is noticable on many buildings. Canoe rentals have been discontinued, our cabin was very small, had no blankets (in mid-January), was missing toilet paper and a coffee pot when we arrived, but the office staff quickly brought a small coffee pot and toilet paper after we called to let them know (we didn't mention the blankets because we brought our own). The cleaning lady and the lady at the front desk were very friendly and helpful, but you can sense that they know the condition of the park has decreased from its former glory. Our cabin (#11) was tiny, but located right on the water. The room with two beds was smaller than a typical hotel room. The bath and kitchen also very tiny. There was a good size screened in front porch and huge screened in back porch (some wood rot made it feel unsafe in spots). Unfortunately, because the temps were so cold we spent very little time on the porches.  The cost to rent the cabin was $80 a night, but we've spent less for much nicer accomodations at other Mississippi State Parks. There is also a 2 night minimum for cabin rentals here, making this experience too expensive for a return visit.

We pulled our camper in here and stayed for one night on a long trip from Tennessee back to Texas. This campground is so beautiful. We woke up to an amazing view in the woods and on the banks of the lake. It is quiet, peaceful, serene and just makes you enjoy camping. Sites are spacious. Clean bathhouse.

Also, pleasantly surprised to discover a little playground right behind our campsite. The kids loved it in the morning as we were packing up. They had a huge water slide too. We didn’t get a chance to use it but it looked awesome.

We could have stayed at this campground a couple of days if time would have allowed. 

Easily accessible off of I-20.

Very friendly staff with southern hospitality.

It has a nice lake to fish, swim, boat, or water ski in. It also has a swimming pool and a water slide if you don't want to swim in the lake. The staff was very nice. The cabin we stayed in (#11) has  screened-in front and back porches with picnic tables it has a bar-b-q pit outside. It sleeps 4 but has not been updated in a long time if I had to guess I would say the 70s. The beds were not that comfortable. There is no table in the cabin so you have to go outside on the porch to eat. I like eating outside so that didn't bother me.There is a refrigerator, stove, coffee pot, and microwave, but no toaster. If you plan on cooking you will need to bring your own pots, pans, ect. They is two very small pots, one frying pan, one big serving plate, spoon, fork, and spatula. plastic plates, cups, bowls and silverware for 4 and that it.

name: The Manship Wood Fired Kitchen
address: 1200 N State St #100, Jackson, MS 39202, USA
reviews: Probably one of my favorite places to go in Jackson.  The bar is incredible.  It actually took my breath away when I first walked in, because it's just that stunning with it's floor to ceiling assortment of wines and liquors. That and the fact that the smell coming from the kitchen was divine - I was hooked before I even sat down to eat!  THEN I ate.....no matter what you try here , I promise - it will be incredible! The steaks, fish, pizza....you cannot go wrong. Oh, and their ranch dressing is drinkable. Seriously.

The place was a little loud, this was first time  I was there when there was a lot of people. The food was excellent, I had a fire grilled whole red snapper which was very well seasoned and was enough for two people. My salad was large and very good also.  While Manship has a large wine selection they charge a premium price and then some.  Some wine by the glass were as much or more than the bottle price at other top restaurants. Service this night was a little slow and we had trouble flagging down the server for water.

Food was very rich and wonderfully flavored. The wait staff was excellent, polite, and knowledgeable. This place is beautifully decorated with attention to detail. The tuna dip was so flavorful, and my fiance and I loved the short rib ragu, fennel lasagna, and the Spanish home fries.

The pizza was good except for the basil being baked in the pie. It should go on top when the pie is taken out of the hob, it was nearly burnt. The Cesar salad was very good. It was covered in plenty of dressing. Most places barely put dressing on the salad. There was no hint of fish in the dressing, another plus. There is no salt or pepper available for customers at the table. I asked for black pepper and was given way more than needed in a little pot (see picture). Cut bread and olive oil with red and black peppers is served at the beginning. It was good too. I ordered the Smoked Gouda Grits which was good. The grits seemed to have yellow corn in them like polenta. The seats were dirty when we got to the table and had to be cleaned. We never could order anything to drink except for water. All in all it was a good meal.

I really wish I could.have rated this higher. The atmosphere was great, as were the staff and our server. The flavor profiles for the food were a bit off. The complementary focaccia bread and oil were good, but oil needs to be served in a shallower dish so seasoning at bottom can be tasted. Crab beignets (crab cake balls) while full of crabmeat, lacked seasoning. The color slaw could use a bit of sweetness. The grilled chicken on my ceasar salad, while it was flavorful, the texture was off, slightly rubbery. The best parts were the sweet tea and the triple chocolate (white, milk, and dark) mouse. I would go back for drinks and dessert.

name: Lower Mississippi River Museum
reviews: This place was fantastic. The staff was very helpful. It was pouring rain when we came in and they offered us paper towels to dry off with and gave us directions to start the tour. Lots of interactive items in the building .learned alot but the real fun was going on to the ship it was self guided and was incredible to see from the pilot house all the way down to the engine room with tons of facts along the way!

I think this Museum is supposed to be geared towards kids, but as an engineer I loved it! I spent a lot of time here with family looking at the power of water and everything the corps of engineers has done to engineer the power of the river. A really fun place to stop by if you are visiting Vicksburg.
A great way to get a glimpse of the Corps of Engineers mission on the Mississippi River and tour a large Corps vessel from pilot house to engine room.
So much history presented really well. And we loved the boat! Would be great for school trips or a home school field trip.

We have visited this museum EVERY year for the last five years.  It is full of history, and even with a four year old, the tour is very manageable on your own without a guided tour.  Great place to visit.

name: Dr. Rhett Hobgood, Shoulder and Elbow Orthopedic Surgeon - Sports Medicine
address: 1325 E Fortification St, Jackson, MS 39202, USA
reviews: I love how he explained things so that I could understand what I was going through. He was very sensitive to my feelings about my pain and was willing to do what it took to help me feel better.

Dr. Rhett Hobgood @ Mississippi Sports Medicine and his staff are fantastic. The environment is nice and comfortable. Dr. Hobgood is great at explaining his diagnosis and surgical procedure. I highly recommend Dr Rhett Hobgood and staff at Ms Sports Medicine you can't go wrong . He's very courteous. They all were . Facilities are very sanitary.
I was very pleased with the atmosphere. The doctor was extremely professional as well as attentive. I am very happy we chose this doctor and facility.

All I’ve heard from people is how bad shoulder surgery is to repair my rotator   The entire experience with Dr Hobgood has been a pleasant one. Never had to wait longer than 5 min to go back & maybe another 5 to get seen.  The initial surgery went well & proper expectations set   I would rec him & facility to anyone.
The atmosphere was very pleasant and the staff had very good personalities. Thanks for taking the time to assist me.

name: Vicksburg Riverfront Murals
reviews: Novel way to beautify the rather unattractive flood gates. Each gate is painted with Vicksburg history and an informational plaque.  Most of my pics are cropped, making it hard to realize, the murals are like 10 feet high by 20 ft long!! Worth a visit.

Very nice murals along the levee, and a park/playground as well! If you go on the other side of the levee you can go right down to the water. There’s also a spot on the wall that marks how high the river has flooded at different times historically. Driving through old downtown Vicksburg to get here is an experience too.
It was so interesting to see and read about Vicksburg back in the day. The murals were awesome! If you get a chance to go, it's worth the drive and the walk!
It was pretty fun! I went with some family from Canada and we loved the history lesson the tour guide told us about the murals!
Very nice historic location

name: Lake Lincoln State Park
address: 2573 Sunset Rd NE, Wesson, MS 39191, USA
reviews: Went overnight tent camping here with my son. We had a great time, the beach is very nice, the primitive sites could have used some seclusion but were well equipped. The hiking trail was quite disappointing a quarter of it passed through parking lots, not what you might expect from a nature/hiking trail at a state park
Beautiful. Very quiet. So many options of things to do. We stayed in the cottages.
We have another day to explore but so far it's great! Highly recommend the waterfront sites.
Not fancy, clean, friendly staff.  Extra effort whenwe checked inaround 8 pm.  Knowledgeable re local interests.  Mostly permanent campers, but we liked it.
Always enjoy fishing swimming and camping primitive or cabins... nice quiet place.

name: Saltine Restaurant
reviews: What an amazing restaurant! First time to Jackson and I was blown away by how delicious the food was. I ordered the Comeback Chicken Sandwich and my girlfriend had the catfish and chips. Both were outstanding! It has an interesting vibe and feels like you’re sitting in what used to be an old college lecture hall. We’ll definitely be coming back the next time we are in Jackson.
Absolutely delicious! And the service was excellent! Very personable! 100% recommend. We went for brunch and loved it. A little pricey- but worth it.

On a recent trip to Mississippi, I went out with my Jackson food crew. I was their guest that night and luckily I ended up at one of Jackson’s finest establishments, Saltine restaurant. Saltine is a widely known Creole and seafood local hotspot in a very modern, trendy but still a touch rustic setting. My foodie friends were veterans of the Jackson food scene, so I sat back and let them order !!

Great food, great service, and an excellent happy hour menu. We were seated with a group of ten within a few minutes and all of the food came out hot and delicious! Would definitely go back if in Jackson again!

This place has some of the best seafood I've ever had in my life. The wood-fired Biloxi snapper, oyster sampler, shrimp boil, grits and hot chicken are AMAZING. Definitely making a trip to Jackson just for Saltines!

name: Dr. Mark A. Runnels, MD
reviews: The experience was quite a delight.  The nurse was very nice and kept me entertained while she took my vitals.  Then the lady who did my ultrasound was just as nice and gentle. She made sure I was not too uncomfortable during the process.   Lastly,  Dr Runnels was just as nice as his staff.  He asked question and told me what to do to try and remedy why I kept experiencing my problem.  The entire experience, I must say, was a pleasant one.

My appt. was a t 2:00pm but I wasn't seen until 3:00pm.  I arrived at 1:45pm. I am a very punctual person & I don't like to wait long periods of time.  Dr. Runnels though was very considerate, knowledgeable, and "LISTENED" to what I had to say, very important!  He is a very pleasant Dr. to talk to.

Dr Mark Runnels is my doctor. He is very thorough in his examination and questions concerning my health condition. He always suggests what is my best options and explains in layman’s terms so I am well informed.

After going to one of the Merit hospitals Emergency Rooms while trying to give birth to a kidney stone, I was told to follow up with a urologist in FOUR days if it wasn’t any better. I was trying to pass a kidney stone that would not pass! Not sure how many of you have tried to pass a kidney stone but waiting FOUR days was not an option.  I then went to the Baptist ER and in a matter of a few hours Dr Runnels had completely taken care of the problem. Any future issues with kidney stones will be treated by Dr Runnels. Very professional, concerned and a pleasure to work with. Thank you Dr Runnels for all that you did

Results- untimely  
Did not care about my pain. 
Can't read report. Could not identify spot in cat scan after 2 scans. Could not deduct how frightened he made me. Just plain didn't care. I do not want him to be my doctor ever. I do not want him to touch me.

name: McRaven Tour Home
reviews: This is the best tour I've been on. I certainly recommend this to anyone from Vicksburg as the history of McRaven is specific to the history and founding of Vicksburg, Mississippi. The tour guide, John, was exceptional! At night you can take a ghost tour rather than the historical tour that's offered in the daytime. The daytime rate to tour is $15.00 per person. It is well worth the cost. Thank you McRaven and staff. It's a memory and experience I will forever remember.

We visited during a small reenactment. My little one was able to light the cannon! We only toured the grounds, not the home. The staff we talked with was informative & gracious. I thought the wrought iron gate was interesting for its uniqueness.8

My daughter & I tremendously enjoy history & learned a lot. It was fascinating & a must see in my opinion. These gems are rare & I’m thrilled someone cares enough to try & keep these old homes up. Fascinating & I would have paid more to see it.
This was a wonderful experience! Our tour guide Daniel was extremely knowledgeable about the property and was also very helpful. This tour is well worth seeing!

First toured McRaven about 15 or 20 years ago. Just took the tour again yesterday.  Loved it! We live in Vicksburg, so when we have guests with limited time we have a hard time deciding which of the many attractions to show. Now McRaven will definitely be a main attraction! It is a historical gem.

name: Dr. James A. Underwood, MD
reviews: Staff was very professional, available and knowledgeable about the entire procedure.  They certainly wanted to make sure you were comfortable and safe.  Dr. Underwood was open in what was going to take place during the procedure and detailed about results.  All together a great experience for a rather dreaded procedure!

Everyone very courteous. Move you through the process very expeditiously. Had a 9:45 appt and asked to come 30 minutes earlier. Got there at 9:04 was immediately received in, was complete and on my way home at 10:48 .Very short waiting time between processing in, filing out a short form, verifying information,,having vitals checked, waiting to see  doctor, seeing doctor and scheduling  next appt.
