My experience last week was extraordinary from the moment of scheduling to the time I drove away. Dr. Underwood and the staff at GI are the kind of people who demonstrated compassion and treated me as if they knew me personally. Not only their kindness but the fact that I did not have to wait for the diagnosis to arrive in the mail days or even weeks later is a godsend. I am impressed and so very grateful!! God bless you all.
Great staff, quick, professional process. Everything explained up front, all questions answered. Comfortable environment .

Friendly staff. Nurse Practitioner Upchurch was very thorough explaining to me what to expect for my impending procedure. She addressed me with a smile and made me very comfortable. Even when setting up my appointment the lady that assisted me was awesome 👏🏽!! Wish I could remember her name. We talked about her daughter being in the service and me being a veteran. Hands down GI Associates clinic has the best staff ever!! Even the lady that greets you as soon as you walk in the building was great. Wish other clinics could pattern their customer experience with GI Associates!! Good Job 👍🏾!!

name: The Old Depot Museum
reviews: The kids loved the Old Depot Museum.  The displays of model trains and detailed models of ships, buildings, and battlefields were amazing.  Definitely put this museum on your family To Visit list if you're in the Vicksburg area!

Very friendly staff! Knowledgeable as well!! They've got some cool little set ups to check out.  It's about five bucks to see the museum.  Free for military.  The gift shop has some great gifts that are way cheaper than some of the same gifts at the national park.  So if you're going to do some gift shopping, this is a good place to get some cool stuff.

This is a very cool place. The scale models inside are amazing and there is a scale model of the battle for Vicksburg that was so helpful in understanding the battle placements. Curators are really nice.

Absolutely loved this museum. Unbelievable diorama of the Siege of Vicksburg. There is a world-class collection of river boats of every kind imaginable. The artist/model maker was there when we visited and was amazing to talk to.

Trains of all scales are in one area of the museum. Children of all ages are mesmerized just taking it all in. Great job!!

Finally, enough cannot be said about the docents and knowledgeable staff. Don't miss the one-of-a-kind museum.

This place is a GEM.  The two lady docents that work there are knowledgeable and friendly. You can’t go wrong by coming here. You’ll get a real insight into life in Vicksburg before, during and after the Civil War. Model trains, paddle boats, blockade runners and a movie that will give you insight into the civilian experience in the Civil War in Vicksburg. Great gift shop too

name: Jackson Thyroid & Endocrine Clinic PLLC
reviews: Great experience. Dr. Sistrunk is a great doctor. He took time to go over my history and my diagnosis. He showed me my images and labs and explained what they meant. He explained to my diagnosis to me and how he came up with the diagnosis. The staff was very professional, nice and helpful. I would highly recommend Jackson Thyroid and Endocrine to anyone with thyroid issues.
Great experience! Friendly staff. Dr. Sistrunk is very thorough. He takes his time and explains it all.

Received excellent care. Dr. Sistrunk spent over an hour with me explaining things and answering my questions. He was also extremely thorough and went all the way back to the records from my initial diagnosis of thyroid disease. The staff is friendly and efficient as well. The wait was not long either.

I have never experienced a doctor like Sistrunk!! He takes his time going over your medical records with you. He spent over an hour in the exam room with me explaining everything. He’s by far the best endocrinologist I’ve met. He do have nurses but I noticed he like to do hands on with his patients so he’ll know exactly what is going on. I have already started recommending him to family and friends. 😊
Always a pleasure to see Dr Sistrunk. He’s thorough, extremely competent & wonderfully kind.

name: BABALU® - Jackson
reviews: Such a fantastic Jackson restaurant! The margaritas and food are delicious!  I am a huge fan of this place because it's family friendly, but also a great option for date night!  Also - brunch is SO GOOD.  My favorite marg is the Notorious PINK one - hands down my favorite in the city. They have a great happy hour, excellent service and a fun atmosphere.  Also - the guacamole is a great meal by itself!  :)

This place was absolutely amazing. Ordering the guacamole was an experience on its own. They make it fresh right in front of you and it is absolutely delicious. I would also recommend the Mexican street corn. Like heaven in your mouth. We ordered 4 tacos, all great, a kids burger, two margaritas and a sangria. Our bill was 74. Given the quality of the food this was a great price. Also super kid friendly. The place was loud so kids are not a problem. I loved the decor as well. If it wasn't so hot in the afternoon we would have eaten outside. So far this has been my favorite restaurant while visiting Jackson.

AMAZING Food and Service. We have three kids and our waiter, Kevin, was exceptional! We tried several things from there menu and were not disappointed!!!  Plus, the kids meal are super impressive (which is really rare).  We drove about 15mins out of the way for this place and it was totally worth it. Highly recommend!
The burgers are good. Tacos not worth the money. Definitely would recommend eating in. Never order take out. If to go is needed do green ghost

Arrived in Jackson in time for lunch - downtown area was deserted but here it was crowded. I guess this is where everyone goes on Sunday. Service was great even with the number of people dining I did not have to wait more than a few minutes for a table for one. The menu is full of interesting items and I had a very difficult time picking. I went with the Cuban sandwich and coffee. Both were excellent - the sandwich was a good as those I have had made by Cubans in Key West. Each table is given chips and a melted cheese dip. Thanks goodness I had not ordered more food because that dip was the best. I ate all of it.

name: Char Restaurant
address: 4500 Interstate 55 North Frontage Rd, Jackson, MS 39211, USA
reviews: Have now been to Char 4 times, twice around Christmas time 2017 and twice around Christmas 2019.  Experiences have always been great. Staff is very attentive, without being solicitous. Service is quick and professional. Drinks are well mixed. Nice wine list; limited, but good section of beer. Great appetizers and salads; except seafood should be off the menu if it has been frozen or refrozen. Steaks are excellent, but, not great. Nice decadent deserts.

Always great food and service.Waiting area isn't very big. Love the new larger back area addition. 
Downside they always run out of crab claws!! Triple your order please. My twins love them, it's hard to tell a 6 year old after they've ordered those little suckers sorry babies they are all gone ☹😂. Would you like something else? ??? Of course not they are six! I'm 40 and about to cry over them being gone. Great place to eat with family and friends.

The ambiance is always nice and this time was no exception. Our server was beyond courteous and conversational but not overly. The food was delicious (I had the pan seared redfish); so much so I wanted more. The menu never disappoints whether I'm dining for lunch or dinner.

We tried this place for the first time last night. Went with my dad for a nice dinner and Char did not disappoint! Fried green tomatoes were so so but the red fish with broccoli was amazing. Pecan pie with vanilla stole the show. Will definitely be back here soon. The whole fare is pricey but I liked the restaurant and food so wouldn't mind paying. Can't believe we didn't try Char earlier!

This first time we ate at this restaurant. A bit pricy but we deserved all the pampering we received. Jessica was our server, she was fantastic, refilled our drinks. We went around brunch time. We ordered steak( Cooked to perfection} & redfish she suggested a different sauce than what was on the menu. My friend was well satisfied. So much food had to get a to-go box. Surprised us with a free hot pecan pie with ice cream! We will go again for a special occasion!

name: The Pig & Pint
address: 3139 N State St, Jackson, MS 39216, USA
reviews: Great place to meet friends. The outdoor tables have a good view! Sometimes the view is a highway but this is in a charming neighborhood with plenty of activity. I had thought I would eat responsibly but I saw an order of nachos go by and impulsively ordered them. They are delicious and well worth the calories! Big enough to share too. The ribs are awesome. Get the dry rub and add the sauce!! The pork rinds are done just right. The white chocolate bread pudding is a must.

Great food. Helpful staff. We had a large party of 8 and they were patient with us. Brisket was very juicy. Tacos were good. Ribs were great. Wings we got dry with sauce on the side. Beer was great, tons to choose from. Place was very laid back, and family friendly. Bathroom was cute with the poop plunger and the power mixer paddle as the toilet paper holder. Very creative! Would definitely recommend.

As soon as I opened the car door, the scent of smoked meat hit me, fair amount of parking and outdoor seating. I ordered takeout, half rack ribs/wet and a pound of pork. The rib flavor was incredible, great balance of chipotle and garlic with good bark. It was rather fatty like it hadn't rendered the fat enough. The pulled pork was spot on.

One week I was craving BBQ so I decided to try y'all out. I will say its not bad but if you like an oven broiled/wood chips flavor. The meat was coated heavily in pepper and spices and BBQ sauce but it didn't pack a char grilled taste. I would give it an A for tenderness but overall taste I will definitely say the sides make up for that. Baked beans and Mac and cheese were on point.

Great place to meet friends. The outdoor tables have a good view! Sometimes the view is a highway but this is in a charming neighborhood with plenty of activity. I had thought I would eat responsibly but I saw an order of nachos go by and impulsively ordered them. They are delicious and well worth the calories! Big enough to share too. Great selection for entrees and sides. Minimal inside dining. Bench type tables for outside dining in the shade of outside roof. Love their bbq sauces on the table. Really love the Carolina style (yellow) sauce. My favorite is the brisket and pulled pork tacos. Sometimes the food is not warm enough. Other than that it’s great.

name: BRAVO! Italian Restaurant & Bar
address: 4500 I-55 N, Highland Village, Suite 244, Jackson, MS 39211, USA
reviews: My friend and I frequently eat at Bravo because we enjoy the varied selection of dishes. We particularly like the pasta and pizza, but we have never had a bad meal . Also, we routinely dine at Bravo with a group of friends before attending plays at New Stage. We can count on having delicious meals with a great selection of wines and tempting desserts. The staff always makes sure we are served with time to get to the play.

We celebrated my sister's 60th birthday here (one of my favorite local restaurants) and it was her 1st time dining here. She fell in love from the moment she entered. The atmosphere, excellent customer service, the manager checking in on us and cracking a few good jokes and making sure we were having a good time all contributed to this being an amazing day for her. They always strive to make every moment special and I've never had a bad service experience here. I don't know how they continue to hire such wonderful staff but they should offer a training course to some of the other restaurants around here! If you're visiting Jackson, MS I definitely recommend you try this restaurant! It's a local favorite. Thanks Bravo team for making this evening for my sister one to remember.

My husband and I visited Bravo for our Anniversary. We enjoyed the atmosphere. Our server was great. The food was delicious and fulfilling. However, the only thing that bothered us was that the gentleman that sprinkled cheese on the entrees that were being served did not wear gloves. He did this with his bare hands. This is not sanitary. After seeing this, we opted for no cheese or garnish on our dish. Bravo, please change this serving policy. Overall, everything else was great.

My friend and I frequently eat at Bravo because we enjoy the varied selection of dishes. We particularly like the pasta and pizza, but we have never had a bad meal . Also, we routinely dine at Bravo with a group of friends before attending plays at New Stage. We can count on having delicious meals with a great selection of wines and tempting desserts. The staff always makes sure we are served with time to get to the play.
One of the places I love visiting. I had the brie appetizer, lasagna and salad. The service was great and so is the management team.

name: Aladdin Mediterranean Grill
reviews:
A nice treat at a great price. 
We were really impressed with the atmosphere and the friendly service.  
I wasn't really sure what to order and the waiter gave me a great suggestion to combine the sauteed vegetables with gyro!  Great idea! 
The parking is a little scary but it is well worth it.

On a 16 hr road trip with several kids we looked up this place 4 hrs before Jackson. Made a reservation and from the moment I walked in they made us feel like home. 

Order their family platter with 2 orders of lamb chops. Extra humus and tea.

This was our early dinner before heading to TX. 

Thanks for feeding us and letting us take over the entire corner. The lady who took our order and managed to keep track of all the dishes was simply AWESOME !!!

Authentic Mediterranean food! My gyro sandwich was exceptional. The iced tea was cold and minty. The food is very affordable the the portions are substantial.

If you are tired of ordinary chain restaurants, this place is one of a kind, comfortable and inviting. We are glad we decided to try Aladdin's.

Great Mediterranean food in Jackson, MS.
They got a good variety of entrees. Chicken Lula was our favourite during our visit. We friends visited this place on the way back from our camping trip. We were 14, the waitresses rearranged the table for us to accommodate all 14 in a single table. Will definitely visit again if I am in Jackson again. Keep doing the wonderful work guys. I have added some photos to show how the ambience of the restaurant is. Hope this is helpful for future visitors

I had the Vegetarian Platter, and it was amazing.  The falafel was crispy, and the hummus had a surprisingly strong lemon bite. Portion sizes are generous. I had to make sure I saved room for baklava. Service was friendly and reasonably fast considering how crowded they were.

name: Walker's Drive In
address: 3016 N State St, Jackson, MS 39216, USA
reviews: While driving through Jackson, we needed food and a place to stay. We read some reviews for this and decided to go. It was a great experience overall: service, drinks, food! I think we may have been a bit under dressed than some of the others, but that didn't seem to be a problem. I am so glad we decided to go here! After weeks of rain, the clouds parted and I met a friend at Walkers Drive In. First of all it is not a Drive In, it is a sit and eat, in or our, Art Deco Style chic but easy Restaurant that is always almost full of diners who, like me come back over and over again.

Excellent food and service.  The red fish with lump crab was amazing!  Wonderful flavors cooked right.  The red snapper with mushrooms and capers was also a real treat.  Alex was a pleasure to deal with and provided excellent, friendly service while answering questions and making suggestions.  Then to top it all off we delighted in the Mississippi peach fried pie, dusted with cinnamon and sugar served with a vanilla bean ice cream and white chocolate sauce. It was absolute heaven.  Crisp and clean flavor. Not overly sweet or oily tasting. Sheer perfection.  You cannot go wrong dining at Walker’s Drive-In.
Excellent service, fresh and delicious food! The veal and lobster kathy was unforgettable! Definitely the best upscale restaurant in Jackson.

We had to wait just a few minutes for our table for two, but it was well worth the wait. The main dining room is very small and sometimes you have to almost turn sideways to negotiate a table, but again well worth it. The food was out of this world. We had a wonderful wedge salad with a "to die for" filet served over a cheddar mash wth asparagus. The beef was almost tender enough to cut without a knife and the potatoes had a wonderful flavor. For desert I had some sort of decadent chocolate cake with vanilla ice cream while my companion had a grapefruit "tart" desert. We both agreed that our dining experience at Walker's was one of if not the best dining experience in a long time.
This is hands-down the best restaurant in Jackson.  And honestly, it’s reasonably priced too.  Try the sea bass if you’re a fish lover!

name: Parlor Market
address: 115 W Capitol St, Jackson, MS 39201, USA
reviews: Have come here about 8 times since 2017. At that point, there was not much in the downtown Jackson area at night; now the place is much busier....great news for Jackson. Never have had a bad pasta; all made in-house. We had a triple fin white fish that was amazing just before Christmas. Despite the risotto being a bit overpowering for the fish, the fish was one of the best white fish we have ever had in our international travels. I come here for business at least once a month and make sure to come back to visit every 3-4 months.

Wow! What a great experience we had in hosting our son's rehearsal dinner with Parlor Market. It was held in their gorgeous private room, 'Albert's', a few doors down from the restaurant. From the start, we had superb communication with great listening--making our event what we wanted (not what they wanted). I love how they manage to 'yes' and are customer driven. The food was exquisite. The service was impeccable. I can not rave enough about the attention to detail in food preparation/presentation, graciously kind service and an overall level of excellence in hospitality. Thank you Parlor Market for making our evening so very special! We especially thank chefs Joe and Robert and our incredible team of Taylor, David, Jennifer, Mackenzie, Vince and Matti. You were all superb and we loved working with you.

I have never minded paying for food, but every single item at parlor market is over priced by about 30%. Its not that any of the food or service is bad, its just that it is hard to justify buying their 38 dollar steak, when you know its not as good as other steaks you have had at that price range. same for the pasta (shrimp scampi), hangar steak (which is their signature, and is simply not great). I have now eaten there 3 separate times, and thought the exact same thing each time - I could do better.

Have come here about 8 times since 2017. At that point, there was not much in the downtown Jackson area at night; now the place is much busier....great news for Jackson. Never have had a bad pasta; all made in-house. We had a triple fin white fish that was amazing just before Christmas. Despite the risotto being a bit overpowering for the fish, the fish was one of the best white fish we have ever had in our international travels. I come here for business at least once a month and make sure to come back to visit every 3-4 months.
Fantastic meal with great service by Lloyd. Enjoyed the Caesar salad , grouper special with lobster risotto and carrot cake special with house made ice cream. Among our top meals anywhere anytime.

name: Keifer's Restaurant
address: 120 N Congress St, Jackson, MS 39201, USA
reviews: Speedy service, even with a fairly long line and call in orders, and everyone was friendly on the line, too. Great tzatziki sauce. Wasn't sure what cottage fries were (basically imagine a potato sliced like bread and then fried), but they were pretty good and servings are perfect for lunch portions. Gyro was very good, and wrapped up to keep me from becoming a mess, which I really appreciated. Quick, friendly, and kept level heads even when a customer was complicating their order.
Genuinely friendly staff and a very fair amount of food. Potatoes seemed under-seasoned, but that's a small gripe.super fast lunch too. Seems like a great choice for someone working downtown.

My vegetarian friend and I were hungry after a morning of sight-seeing - and this place was on our meanderings, trying to find a place for lunch. I saw what I thought was a place with veggie burgers BUT it wasn't. When the woman behind the counter saw my slightly disappointed face, she remedied the "problem" and made me (and my friend) a FANTASTIC improvised "burger" of piled high sauteed mushrooms, peppers, onions, fresh tomato slices and a yummy sauce on a big wrap. My friend and I were in HEAVEN. And the way the potato was prepped was a first-time for us both - and I wish I could remember the name the place had given it.

Great local joint. Our family's favorite burger hands down. I've tried several items form the menu and none have disappointed. Good prices and quick service make it a no brainier. Only downside is parking downtown 😕
One of the best Gyros I've eve had! Owner suggested to add mozzarella cheese and man it was good! See ya next time!

name: Scrooge's Fine Foods & Drink
reviews: We had the fried pickles (huge serving) and the fried green tomatoes as appetizers. Both were good. The pickles were definitely dill. We also had the oyster PoBoy and the crab cakes. The bread with the PoBoy was too soft. I prefer a little crispiness in such a sandwich. The crab cakes we're quite good, little or no filler. The waiter was very much on the ball, kept drinks refilled, etc. The food was prepared quickly and served very hot. We would definitely eat there again.

Loved it! The service was excellent! The people was so nice and generous there. The food! I had  Redbeans and Rice. It was delicious, seasoned perfectly, and ready at a timely fashion. I highly recommend this place and will be come back soon. Thank You!

A group of 12 of us were passing through Ridgeland on our way to New Orleans. I called ahead and asked if they could accommodate our group. We arrived 15 minutes later and we were greeted by someone that seemed to be either the owner or a manager. He welcomed us and thanked us for coming. He showed us to a table for 12 that was nicely arranged. Devon was our waiter for the evening. He was very nice and very witty. He answered our many questions and offered his favorites as suggestions. The food was excellent. I didn't ask everyone in our group, but everyone I did ask was completely happy with the food they had and the experience. You should give this place a try.

This was my 1st time being here. The food and service was awesome. Great and delicious burger and fries. The waiter Andrew was right on point, very friendly and fast. I would highly recommend this place and I will be back sometime soon!
It's a great place for family and friends the atmosphere was cozy everyone is soooooo friendly

name: Drago's Seafood Restaurant - Jackson
address: 1005 E County Line Rd, Jackson, MS 39211, USA
reviews: Had lunch here yesterday and this place has gone to he!!. My husband and I both had the seared tuna salad. I had maybe 5 slices of tuna and 1 was the tip of the steak, just a speck. The color was an off purple. My husband's wasn't much better. The oysters were tiny, we ordered a dozen but they gave us 18 to make up for it. Our waiter was super friendly but the woman who seated us never smiled the whole time we were there. It was raining and she escorted us through a patch of carpet with 1/2 an inch of water to splash through because the roof was leaking. I was so looking forward to the delicious salad I had there 2 years ago but that was not to be. $57 + a $10 tip We won't be back.

Celebrated my birthday here and tried the charbroiled oysters and I must say they were amazing!!! The atmosphere  was very pleasant and the restaurant crew were all very helpful.  Our waiter Michael was the BEST!!! He was very attentive to us and also made sure our drinks were steadily refilled.  I would recommend Drago's and plan on coming back soon!!! Thank you for making my birthday celebration a success!!!

The restaurant is really nice. Our waiter was absolutely great. We had the Gator bites, which were super yummy. The Seafood Pasta and BBQ Shrimp PO-Boy were both great as well. It IS pricey, but our portions on everything were huge! Definitely left full!

We stayed at the Hilton while traveling through the area and the front desk highly recommended them. The charbroiled oysters were awesome. My husband got the boneless short ribs and they were amazing as well, so tender and flavorful. I got the lobster and it was good. A little on the small side, but good. The service was great as well and the prices were fair for what you got. We would recommend them and will be back if in the area.

Went on a Sunday afternoon when it wasn't busy.  Are waiter was very attentive.  The food was excellent, and was able to relax and enjoy myself. I would recommend to anyone looking for a good pasta dish or seafood.  It's a little pricey, but it's worth it.

name: Lou's Full-Serv
address: 904B E Fortification St, Jackson, MS 39202, USA
reviews: This place is somewhat of a hidden gem. The hamburger itself was not the standard burger joint frozen thin one. It was thick about a quarter inch or more. I had a choice of side. I got the onion rings. These were outstanding too. Not frozen ones that I cannot stand. They have a different evening menu but I think it looks good. I intend to go back and try the sword fish steak

Seeking an alternative to the usual suspects when visiting Jackson over night, I was told to check out Lou's. Located in a gentrified 1960's shopping center on Fortification, Lou's turned out to be a delightful spot for dinner. It was a chilly night and their comfort food took care of its business. Braised Short Ribs and a proper Pittsburgh Rare Beef steak found happy homes..........oh, my scotch was fair enough and the service was professional too.

Every dish we ordered was Very tasty!  Yes it is kind of pricey for what you get, but it was absolutely delicious.   Cut the tails off your shrimp and grits.  Red fish was done perfectly and I’m a picky fish eater.  Short ribs were a nice tasty hunk of meat.  And the kids steak was good. 7 year old thought it was a little spicy. (Maybe pepper). Lol

Absolutely amazing. I got the brisket sandwich but oh goodness was it outstanding! Side if onion rings were divine but to top it all off..... 

I don't like bread pudding. At all. But their bread pudding is something I was convinced to try and I was NOT disappointed. I may have eaten too much of it because it was so good!

Yeah, sex is good. But have you had the bread pudding at Lou's? We went Monday and Friday and had two very different experiences. The place was dead Monday and we had extremely attentive service. And since it was our first visit the server gave us stellar recommendations (the teres major was the most perfect medium rare beef I've ever had). Friday was much busier but we still got high quality service. Expensive by Mississippi standards but really great grub. Homemade ice cream, all kinds of fresh goodness. Great cocktails, big selection of bottled beers, no taps.

name: Bully's Soul Food Restaurant
reviews: This place is like taking a step back in time...literally. The outside is very unassuming and the inside reminds me of my great great grandmother's house. Parking is extremely limited. The atmosphere is very pleasant and the employees are quite friendly and welcoming. The decor is very much of times past. Each of the tables are old dining room tables with assorted chairs. The tables clothes all have doilies as place settings. It's wonderful!
Absolutely love Bully's. I recommend every item. Just keep going till you try em all. Delicious, good sized portions and super friendly staff. 100% southern hospitality and comfort food.

Our family was driving through Jackson Mississippi on vacation and I saw this place on TripAdvisor. Always up for an adventure, we went out of the way and are so glad we did! Open since 1982, this family-owned business is definitely worth a visit. Bully himself popped out of the kitchen to welcome us, and the service was super friendly and helpful. We had lunch specials and everyone was super pleased, adults and kids alike. Our favorites were the greens, cornbread, turkey necks, fried chicken, fried green tomatoes, and peach cobbler. DO NOT MISS THE COBBLER!

Food is great so I'm giving it 5 stars. However, if you are from out of state as we were, understand that this is a hole in the wall, the wait for the food will be long, and it will be served on cafeteria style plates; look past that. They put their foot in that food and it is a must if you're in town so you can get that real soul food deliciousness. Definitely check it out.
Such sweet and friendly people with AMAZING food.  My husband was just as happy with his lunch as I was with mine. Everything was DELICIOUS!!

name: Rooster's
address: 2906 N State St #104, Jackson, MS 39216, USA
reviews: The place is in a corner of an inside mall/building. The burgers and fries are great, and the onion rings are some of the best I have eaten (not greasy). We were in a hurry, and although not fast food, it was quicker than most. The chicken is great too. Stopped for lunch- it was sunny, clean, fast, friendly.... and the best chicken sandwich and grilled chicken on salads in a long time. Mac and cheese was decent (not to die for- but a good solid side). Would definitely eat here again. It got busy at noon- we were just a few min ahead of the crowd.

The fried chicken was spot on. I had the fried chicken club and my wife the hot hot fried chicken sandwich. Both were delicious. The only reason I don’t give this place the 5 stars is the curly fries. I love curly fries but these were a bit greasy and lacked some flavor.

The food was delicious . My husband and myself both ordered hamburger steak with 2 sides.  It's the best hamburger steak I have eaten in years.  The atmosphere was great. They had my kind of music playing.  The late 70's and 80's Rock and roll music.  It was so relaxing to sit down and have a great meal.  I will be going back to eat here again.  We were at the University hospital and when I finished up with everything I turned my maps on and asked where a nice close restaurant was to eat at. And it pulled up Roosters.

It's not easy to leave a place like this..and not be absolutely stuffed. 8oz perfectly cooked patty. Huge helping of home cooked fries, and cold crisp cole slaw. I'm in heaven. Make this a bucket list stop. Probably the best burger in Jackson..period.
Food was hot. Service was fast but front of house staff was a little rough around the edges and boisterous. Creole Chop steak was a great lunch choice. Red beans and rice was ok. Generous portions.

name: The Iron Horse Grill
address: 320 W Pearl St, Jackson, MS 39203, USA
reviews: We stopped for lunch while in the area on the recommendation of the guys at the Hawkins Jet Center. We were very pleased. The service was amazing. I forget the ladies name who served us, but she was getting married soon. She was amazing and on top of everything. We never wanted for anything. The chips they bring were awesome, love the flavor of the spices that they put on them and the salsa was really good too, without being too hot. My husband ordered the ribs and was very pleased with them. The atmosphere is really nice and love all of the woodwork in the place. Would recommend to anyone and when we are in the area we will come back.

I've eaten here a few times, but had never been with a large group for a work function until recently. I wasn't sure how it would go over, but it turned out to be great time. The food was excellent, and the staff was wonderful. We had our function upstairs and had plenty of room even with having over 100 people. The only complaint we heard was that the parking was limited. But with a group our size, it would have been better to do more carpooling.

Wasn't sure what to expect but received great service and delicious food. Other's kids were there having a great time. The stage is beautiful, would love to go back and see a good show. And so many unique things inside to see. Worth a visit or more.

Apparently, I wasn‘t expecting a longer break during my Greyhound travel (1 hour). So I was just seeing this grill when we were driving by and I decided to quickly go in there and check what they have and if I can take it with me. At the end, it was just SO good I did so! I just wish there was more time to discover the grill itself a bit longer... I ordered a small cup of chili together with the Iron House Salad (with blue-cheese dressing) for taking out. While waiting, I grabbed the chance to step into the ‚museum‘ they have on the 1st floor. Even that was quite fun and experiencing, too.

Great Food! Decor is overall awesome! Perfect if you love live music! They have weekly lunch specials that are great! If you want a to come in and rock out or just have a few drinks combined with great food, this is your place!

name: Keifer's
reviews: The waiter recommended the beef and cheese gyro. It's much similar to a Philly cheese steak. It's really good and I added mushrooms. The pita moz is my go to appetizer. You guys should try it. I like to try a different dish on each visit. Great Greek food. Although, Lunch time was busy the waiter made us feel as if we were his only patrons. A wrap and fries is too much for one person

I liked Keifer’s.  Good food.  Reasonably priced.  And I love a menu that has instructions!  I’d definitely go again.  Pictured below are the cottage potatoes and a veggie sandwich with mozzarella (sorry I already took a bite).

Great people!!   we came in at closing. We were in a hurry working on the ambulance. Had a ride ahead of us. Didn't think we could eat there but they came at us quick.  They were busy but still friendly &   they made fresh hot food and we had a great meal and on our way in no time.  I Wished i lived closer. That was my 2nd Met. Food and it was awesome!!!! Thanks y'all!!!👏👏👏👏
Great Greek food. Although, Lunch time was busy the waiter made us feel as if we were his only patrons. A wrap and fries is too much for one person

The waiter recommended the beef and cheese gyro. It's much similar to a Philly cheese steak. It's really good and I added mushrooms. The pita moz is my go to appetizer. You guys should try it. I like to try a different dish on each visit....

name: Crawdad Hole
reviews: I visited here with a group for a wedding. The bride and groom are locals and visit often. The crawfish and shrimp were both delicious. Suggest getting sausage with the crawfish as well. Great laid back atmosphere. There is an indoor section with A/C as well as outdoor seating with fans for the heat. A must see in Jackson.

This is not the place to eat and be CUTE.  Probably shouldn't wear your "Sunday- go-to-meeting clothes"  to the Crawdad Hole..... cause you cant eat a boiled crawfish with a fork..
😁😁😁 I like the atmosphere, laid back environment..  Old school music, good food.... fantastic

Bring in your own beer for $3
Crawfish are good tasting usually pretty big but do run smaller certain times of the year. Fair price per pound and they also have live music sometimes. Would recommend.
These guys and girls are the best! Enjoy more and more every time we go. The manager is the coolest he makes everyone feel welcome every time!
Food was great! The owner and the staff were friendly.  We would highly recommend this restaurant. It was the best crab and shrimp boil! !

name: 1908 Provisions
reviews: We were tired after driving all day, so was nice to have a restaurant and bar right in the hotel as an option. The Library Lounge (separate review) is right next to the restaurant, and also serves small plates. When we moved to the restaurant, we were the only ones in there, and it stayed that way through our entire meal. Granted, it was a little early, but that was surprising. The decor is nice enough and the place is spotless. We were surprised at how slow it was getting our food, especially since we were the only ones in there. However, the food was quite good.

Beautiful restaurant. But the execution just wasn't there. The music was piped in. The service while polite was, let' say, not prompt. The food was fine but should have been better, e.g. no rare prime rib. Deserts were wonderful.

I was not impressed with the food or the service. We were a group of thirteen with a 7 PM reservation.  We were seated promptly, and basically had the restaurant to ourselves. We had to ask for water — and had to keep asking, as no one was paying attention.  It took a good half hour before the waiter took our entree orders. Our waiter disappeared so often, we joked that perhaps he was also the chef...  Entrees were served at 8:50 PM. My pasta with shrimp was inedible due to the heavy use of spice (and I like spicy food).  Others in the group reported cold soup.  I would not eat there again.

Some of my girl friends and I came for their Sunday brunch. It's in a very cute white building that looks like the Fresh Princes house. There's a live piano player and a nice waiting area with a fire place. The Sunday buffet was $20/person. This rating is just for their brunch, not regular restaurant hours and menu items.

Only thing I really liked was the etouffee and salmon, everything else was just okay. I'd rather spend more on one good plate of food off of their menu.

There's a waffle and omelet station, but isn't much for you choose from to put in your omelet or waffle...

It's a nice white table cloth restaurant, I'd like to come back and try some of their menu items.

It is a beautiful place. We went to a Bourbon event.  The food was served family style.  There was a lot of things to try.  My favorite was the salad and the desserts especially the chocolate pot de cream.

name: Estelle Wine Bar & Bistro
address: 407 S Congress St, Jackson, MS 39201, USA
reviews: We visited here mainly because it was within walking distance of our hotel and it was a good find! We both had pizza (sausage and roasted chicken(, which were yummy, we shared a salad as a starter and it was plenty big for two and had a nice bottle of wine as well. Prices are reasonable, service is good overall and it's nice to have this type of restaurant downtown.

Outstanding food and wait staff!! We had the duck sausage meat and cheese tray salmon deviled eggs and fried chicken!!! Could not have been better served by these folks. The deviled eggs were one grain of salt away from a perfect bite of food

I've been to Estelle multiple times and typically I enjoy my experience but today not so much. I attempted to call and place an order and I kept getting the voice mail. 
I drove over and it shouldn't take over 35 Minutes to get 2 desserts and after waiting all of that time for that order It looks like it was just sloppily put in the container.
(Pics Attached)
Presentation meant nothing today. 
I'm so disappointed in this establishment.
Lovely atmosphere and elegant feel to the space the waitresses are quite efficient however the prices are a bit high but not too much so.

Went there  with a couple of friends and we had a twenty minutes  wait to be seated which that was fine. The waitress and greeter was nice and friendly. When it came to the time to order our food the wait time was supposed to be 15 minutes  but turned out to be about 45 minutes. On my order I order two meals well one never came out and after waiting on my other meal to come it was cold when they brought it out. I never received the second order. I asked the waitress to just cancelled  it. On the order that I did recieved it was not cooked like I asked them to cook my steak I asked for med well. Well it was over well it was burned but I ate it cause I was hungry. I will not be returning  no time soon.

name: Surin of Thailand
address: Exp. Director, 3000 Old Canton Rd, Jackson, MS 39216, USA
reviews: Duck curry is reasonably priced and filling.  It is spicy and sweet with a nice portion of meat.  The fried calamari is disappointing.  I like the tempura batter but there is more batter than calamari.  Sauce tasted like corn syrup not the sweet heat it usually has.  The beef salad was good but did add some heat with the house chili sauce.

I was blown away by how good the food was here. I don't live in the area and was visiting a friend who suggested Surin. We both had the roasted duck curry and it was incredibly flavorful and the perfect level of spice. I would definitely go back if in the area!

Hip, upscale Thai joint in the heart of Findren. I've had many dishes here and everything has been okay to very good, nothing that was bad. I wouldn't call most of the dishes here authentic Thai, but it has its own unique spin, which is delicious and you can't find anywhere else.

It's clean, great for large groups. They have a big drink menu as well, definitely a good place to bring your friends, have a few drinks and talk the night away.

Delicious food in a clean and stylish setting!  Our waitress was super-knowledgeable about the menu and checked on us frequently.  The potstickers made for a tasty appetizer and my "Spicy Beef Noodles" were just about as hot as I could handle! Definitely coming back here!
Friendly staff and delicious food. Husband loves the coconut soup with tofu. The kids love it too! I wouldn't say it's extremely authentic Thai, but it's great.

name: Mayflower Cafe
address: 123 W Capitol St, Jackson, MS 39201, USA
reviews: Always had great grilled gulf fish here previously, but wasn’t too hungry the last visit and had the plate lunch with grilled catfish and 2 vegetables and homemade roll. Unbelievable quality and taste. Included small salad with their famous comeback dressing. Peach cobbler was &1.00 extra and very good. Staff efficient and very friendly. This place covers the waterfront on selection and quality.
One of the best seafood places on my list. Delicious food and fantastic services.

Enjoyed a good lunch here on a visit to Jackson. Sounds like they’ve been around for over 80 years. Grilled chicken salad was tasty and associate had their Tuesday special. Historic location served the Beatles and other special guests in the day. There’s a reason the mayflower has been open so long. Reason is it’s amazing! Retro atmosphere great service incredible food. Redfish was some of the best I’ve had. Use the great rolls to sop up the flavor from the plate. Definitely a place to revisit.

We happened into the Mayflower on a quiet night.  In every sense like dropping back a few decades, including the decor and the friendly, gracious staff.  The salad was small and simple, as I remember their being when I was young, but the secret house dressing was wonderful.  We had stuffed flounder and the fancy trout, and we could not have enjoyed them more.  One of the most enjoyable restaurant experiences I have had in recent memory.

Iron Chef Cat Coral said she always eats here when she's in town, so this place gotta be good. The fried pork chop is nicely seasoned and fried. Stuffed crab was a little small, but probably because it's a lunch portion. Steak was cooked perfectly medium rare. Gumbo was good. I need to come back for their liver and onions, one of my favorite things to eat!

name: Gumbo Girl
address: 900 E County Line Rd Suite 107, Ridgeland, MS 39157, USA
reviews: The decor on the outside and the inside is very beautiful. It was my first time eating at the restaurant and I almost walked out. This place is only opened on Thursday thru Saturday. Since I went on a Saturday night,  they were out of basically half the menu. I still decided to stay and order something and I was glad that I did. I had the fish tacos  and my husband had the red beans and rice. We also had a brownie for dessert. All the food was full of flavor and spicy. The red beans and rice was good but too spicy for my liking. It was my first time trying fish taco but I was very impressed. They were so good with the mild sauce. It was like a sea garden full of flavor. Next time I'll go on a Thursday so I can try more items from the menu

Came here on my husband's birthday. I had the red beans and rice (excellent with full flavor and generous portions), and he had the shrimp tacos (tons of shrimp and good flavor). We didn't wait very long at all.

Don't let the location scare you off (next to a gas station)! The atmosphere is cozy and intimate, service is nice, and the food is great. Not a lot of options on the menu and it's a little pricey, but overall good value for money!

The surf and turf gumbo with shrimp, chicken and sausage is outstanding. It may seem a little expensive but this isn't a thin, watery gumbo with a few ingredients for flavoring. This is a thick, rich gumbo with a lot of ingredients. Expensive to make, great to eat. It was a little hot for the tastes of our eleven year old. Friendly owners and staff provided great service and explanations of the menu. Pleasant to dine in and very well packaged to go orders.

Their house gumbo is the absolute best gumbo I've ever had! I'll add that the house gumbo comes with a kick so be prepared! The staff were attentive and my group never had to ask for refills. The wait time was around 5-10 minutes for the house gumbo and I know for sure that I will be back! The prices were pretty good, around $21 for my meal, and I believe that it was worth every penny! I can't wait to tell the rest of my coworkers and friends about this place!

Delightfully impressed!  The food was as good as the service... EXCELLENT!  As an authentic Cajun from south Louisiana, the food here is very authentic and delicious. Places around here try to be a Cajun restaurant, but often fall short. Gumbo Girl nailed it!  It’s nice to see a place that puts quality over getting your food fast...

name: Crazy Cat Eat Up
address: 1491 Canton Mart Rd, Jackson, MS 39211, USA
reviews: Catfish and meatloaf are amazing. Quiche and salad are a staple and outstanding.

I've been there three times for lunch and every visit has been great. I've had their pimento cheese app, great, and the turkey and brie and ham sandwich both were terrific but will have to save the turkey is my favorite. The only dessert I've tried was the blueberry cobbler which I will definitely get again. I would not hesitate to go again.

Have yet to have lunch here but dinner is amazing. I'd consider dinner here one of the best fine dining experiences in Jackson, comparable to Walker's, Char, and 1908 Provisions from a quality perspective, but more laid back. BYOB! Stop by Briarwood Mart Wine & Spirits (100 yards away) before you head there and let them know you are going to Crazy Cat for your 10% discount on a bottle of wine.
Casual but high quality and reasonable prices.
Amazing food, all locally sourced and so fresh every time!

name: Basil's Fondren
address: 2914 N State St, Jackson, MS 39216, USA
reviews: It’s worth the fight for a parking space to enjoy an Elvis Panini. Peanut butter, bananas, and peanuts on warm panini bread are a delight! It’s unusual enough to be delicious! The employees at Basil's are super nice and always try to please. You have to eat in the hallway after ordering, as the restaurant is a walk-up. If it’s a nice day, you can sit outside. The only problem with eating here is the parking situation.....very limited!
Got the Ham and Salami panini. Bread perfectly pressed and crunchy. Ham and Salami juicy and paired well with the aoli.  Service with a smile.
One of my favorite restaurants in Jackson, every single thing I've had from there is amazing, and I've tried a lot of it. Best pizzas, sandwiches, soup, and chocolate chip cookies in town!
The food here is always so fresh! Great staff and so friendly. This is our favorite place to eat.

Basil's is an excellent spot to get soups, salads and sandwiches. It is vegetarian friendly. I have not personally been to the location but I have had it for take out. I ordered the veggie panini  which is made on delicious foccacia bread. Was filled with cheese, Roma tomatoes, olive salad and pesto mayo. I have also tried their cesar salad and tomato basil soup which is very tasty. Great cookies for those that have a sweet tooth. Recommend checking this place out.

name: Shiro Cafe & Restaurant - Ethiopian cuisine
address: 125 S Congress St ste 106, Jackson, MS 39202, USA
reviews: Stopped in for lunch here the other day and was really glad I did. In this hidden Jackson gem, you get amazing flavors, spices and seasoning all on one plate. You have a variety of choices you can choose from and the staff is friendly and helpful in helping you decide. I got the beef over rice with the cabbage and chick peas. Everything was cooked wonderfully and definitely made a happy plate at the end. If you’re in this part of town and want some great food, this is worth the trip.

The food at Shiro's is so delicious, and incredibly authentic, and honestly you cannot beat the price. $12 plus tip got me a huge lunch platter of injera, beef, beets, lentils, and cabbage. They design the food with the idea of portability in mind too, I could have easily taken my lunch to go and had a lovely little picnic anywhere downtown. I love Ethiopian cuisine, and Shiro's was excellent. Their variety of flavors blended together beautifully to make every bite unique, but still delicious. Stop in for lunch and enjoy!

Delicious. Small place in the middle of a building. It is not a sit-down restaurant, so you just walk up to the counter, look at what is there, order, and have it handed to you. They have you pay when you are done. Make sure you try their bread.

Super cool that this place even exists in Mississippi.

The food at Shiro's is so delicious, and incredibly authentic, and honestly you cannot beat the price. $12 plus tip got me a huge lunch platter of injera, beef, beets, lentils, and cabbage. They design the food with the idea of portability in mind too, I could have easily taken my lunch to go and had a lovely little picnic anywhere downtown. I love Ethiopian cuisine, and Shiro's was excellent. Their variety of flavors blended together beautifully to make every bite unique, but still delicious. Stop in for lunch and enjoy!
Delicious food, great service. Small hole in the wall place. Absolutely worth a visit, will be going back again soon.

name: Sakura Bana
reviews: This is the only “true” Japanese restaurant in the Jackson area (and the only Zagat-rated Japanese restaurant in town) started and run for 30 years by immigrants from Japan. The volcano roll is awesome.
Great food, good service and decent location, will return again

We eat sushi all over the world. Sushi must be fresh and varied to be exceptional. Sakura Bana is owned and run by a Japanese family that knows and lives sushi. The choices and prices are very special. Service is good, parking adequate, ambiance is excellent. This restaurant has something for everyone in a family. The alcohol selection is appropriate and reasonably priced. Uni, toro, anagi, anago, etc are some of the treasures found.

Nice presentation, awesome customer service, very reasonably priced. Downfall is they don't give you complimentary soup or salad like other sushi places. Our server asked if we'd like soup and salad so we said yes, little did we know that we'd be charged for it. Overall still a good experience, we'll definitely be back.

The best sushi restaurant in town! Everything is fantastic here, with attentive staff (Jane, Lauren, Renzo, Austin, Millie, Ariel, Skylar) ! I believe they're still the ONLY Japanese owned restaurant in the whole Jackson metro!

name: Sugar's Place
address: 168 E Griffith St, Jackson, MS 39201, USA
reviews: Guy Fieri needs to make a visit this place is awesome! We came for breakfast and left FULL. We had the Sugars full breakfast grits bacon eggs and toast. The kids had waffles. My friend, being from up North exclaimed these are the best grits I've ever had. This coming from a "Yankee" I would have to say if I lived in the area it would definitely be a go to place. Wish we were going to be in town and have lunch here. All I can say is if you are here you need to stop, and Guy you need to stop in!!

The 4.5+ rating is deceiving unfortunately. Our food was made to order, but the chicken on the biscuit tasted like a frozen patty that had been heated in the microwave, and the waffle is exactly the kind you get at a cheap cafeteria, bland, tough and disappointing. The chicken tenders with my waffle were tasty, but unfortunately not quite enough to counter the lackluster waffle. For as much as they charge for their food, it should taste freshly mixed and made, not freshly pulled from the freezer.

After eating chicken tenders here, I cannot eat chicken tenders anywhere else because nothing else will be as tender and juicy as the ones made at Sugar's.  Their fries are also home made and some of the best I've ever tasted!  Seriously, Sugar's is one of the best places to eat for breakfast and lunch!  They put the "soul" in Soul Food!

Best soul food I’ve ever had. Ordered the chicken and waffles as well as the fried catfish, shrimp, and fries. Fried chicken batter was light, waffles were perfect, syrup was light and sweet. Fried catfish literally melted in my mouth, and even the fries were excellent. Stopped on our way to CO, but I’d stop in Jackson again just for Sugar’s!

Had the pleasure of eating lunch from here.  When I say the food is absolutely incredible.  The flavors and taste was fresh and amazing.  The kool -aid is in a star class all by itself.  The owner was so nice☺️ I give this place more than 5+ stars!!!

name: Edo | Japanese Restaurant
address: 5834 Ridgewood Rd suite c, Jackson, MS 39211, USA
reviews: This place is a great hidden gem. The restaurant is very clean and the service is outstanding. I have enjoyed sushi at many restaurants over the years and this place is one of my favorites. Had lunch at Edo based upon many recommendations! Lunch was reasonably priced and all items were very fresh and the presentation was awesome: simple and colorful! The Seaweed & Squid salads were fantastic! Will eat here again!

Great customer service and awesome food. This is one of the best Japanese restaurant in Jackson metro area. I think it's a bit inexpensive as well when compared to similar restaurants. Don't let outside fool you it's a low key hidden gem. Must visit.
Owner should try to upgrade outside appearance a bit to match service and food.
Only our second time to try Edo, once for lunch and dinner. The fried snapper app was great, our sushi was very good. The staff was friendly with relaxed and efficient service, very enjoyable.

I ordered the hibachi shrimp lunch special. The price was reasonable and food was delicious. It came with miso soup, salad, and the food pictured below. My lunch partner got 4 sushi rolls and loved them all. I think I just found a new lunch stop.
As always the food wad great and the staff very friendly and helpful. A great place to dine.

name: Elvie's
reviews: Best meal in town...just incredible!!  Such a unique menu.  Amazing food, drinks, atmosphere.  Truly a special place...a “must visit” in the Jackson culinary scene!

From the moment you walk in the door you feel like you are the most important person in the room. The atmosphere is unique and welcoming. The wait staff is very friendly and attentive. Every member of the staff is involved in making sure you are taken care of. The beverage selection is varied and upscale. The appetizers are delicious and uniquely displayed. The entrees are well presented and beyond expectation. The deserts are a necessity. They too are beautifully displayed, unique, and delicious. I was there for dinner, but others told me I must come back for breakfast and lunch, which I plan on doing.

Breakfast was phenomenal! We tried the Duck Fat Hash-browns' and my husband got the Eggs Benedict.   The flavor was layered perfectly and the presentation was so thoughtful. The staff was on top of everything from keeping our cups of coffee and water full to answering all of our questions. The atmosphere in there is charming, made us feel like we stepped into a classy NOLA style place from the 30's. Cody and Hunter and their team have put together the most lovely little Jackson restaurant that I know will quickly become a staple. Can't wait until we get to try it out for dinner!

Nailed it! This will quickly become one of the "it" restaurants in Jackson. Great atmosphere, great food and cocktails are thoughtful and fun. When I go out to eat I don't want something I could have cooked at home. Mission accomplished! Food is sophisticated and tasty.
Incredible place! We loved sitting at the bar. The staff is incredible and the food is amazing. Call ahead, they are sure to stay busy!

name: Barrelhouse
address: 3009 N State St, Jackson, MS 39216, USA
reviews: I had wonderfully prepared catfish. Nice and crispy. Not greasy at all. Located in the Fondren District this is a wonderful place to eat and then shop. I did not pick the best for sides. I chose the mac and cheese and pimento and cheese grits. The fried okra was wonderful! Cute atmosphere and area to sit outside! The food was good here! We had meatball subs, buffalo cauliflower and mussels/fries. All were delicious! The prices are reasonable considering the quality of food. Would come back if we were locals! Thank you for the wonderful service as well!

Tuna Nachos and the Cheese plate. 2 things you should eat before you leave this earth.
The nachos are crispy, savory, lots of great textures...the seaweed and sesame seeds my be my favorite parts. The Barrel House margarita is amazing too!

I went with a large group for a birthday party on a Friday night. The food here was amazing, everyone was very pleased with their order. It's got a great atmosphere, friendly wait staff and our bartender Wes was awesome! We didn't even realize there would be live music, which was a bit loud, but the band was great.
Great atmosphere. Great food other than the fact that it’s a bit salty in general. Service could be on a bit slow side at busy hour. Otherwise, come on over!

We had a fun small foodie meet tonight for First Thursday. Although it was busy during first Thursday, our food came out fast and hot!

I ordered the beef meatballs with parmesan cream sauce, the meatballs were moist, well seasoned and loved that it was slightly fried on the outside. Now listen here, this dish is only $5 during 4pm to 6pm social hour! That's a steal! Try all of them! 🤣

The won ton tuna nachos were great, nachos wasn't oily at all and the seaweed salad was great on it. It was a pretty light dish for nachos. Duck fried wings were crispy, I wanted a tad more seasoning, but the fry on it was 👌. 

We all ready enjoyed our food. The service was amazing! Food came out quick, pretty nice place for food and drinks.

Food: 4.7
Service: 5
Atmosphere: 5

name: Sal & Mookie's New York Pizza & Ice Cream Joint - Jackson
reviews: Hey All went to Sal & Mookie's from the walk in it was awesome  very friendly  stuff  the restaurant is very clean great  Atmosphere Our  waitress  is very outgoing  and made sure we had drinks  and our meal was outstanding. We had pizza we created by adding chicken ,green olives ,smoked bacon, mozzarella cheese it was out of this world  awesome and then we had dessert. I had a butterfinger crunch Vanilla Ice cream in  Butterscotch topping my wife had  pecan  square with the ice cream and whipped topping.  At Sal &Mookis'e there is a lot of great choices  and I know We will be back very  soon . And cant wait til they open the mew Sal &Mookie's in Madison  Thanks for a great meal.

Best service ever! Haven't been here since i was a kid and I'm so glad i came back! My son's order took a while to come out and they were very very gracious about getting it right. My waitress Megan was very nice and so was the manager im surprised at the great customer service because nowadays its barely any! I will surely recommend over and over again!
We had a really good experience. Our server knew the menu, had good suggestions. The food was really good. I had the Philly cheese steak and it was delicious. We also tried dessert.

Stayed in jackson overnight on our way to destin. Such a cool and fun atmosphere! Kids can watch pizza making, and all of the staff are very kid friendly. Food served quickly and was delicious. Ice cream parlor in the restaurant was fun too! It is not off the main road so you have to know where you are going to find it but there is plenty of parking and worth finding! My family loved this restaurant. Cannot say enough about them.
Service was great. The pizza was greasy but good. Ice cream was very good!

name: Hal & Mal's
reviews:
Great good and beer. The service was great.y bartender was Chris and he was the nicest. I was solo travelling and we talked for a long time. He provided loads of great recommendations. 
I would go back for the food and great staff.

There was also live jazz band playing on that Wednesday

Looking for a great place to pop in and have lunch in downtown Jackson? This is your place! I could hardly concentrate on the menu due to all the eye candy memorabilia surrounding me! Art, music, photos, and neon lights behind the bar made our visit fantastic. We were in town for the Mississippi Arts Commission arts conference and wanted to have lunch nearby the capital.... we finally decided on catfish poboys and GIGANTIC onion rings....heaven! Before leaving I went to the restroom to wash my hands and discovered cool hand painted stalls,etc! We had the perfect lunch and our server was super nice. Highly recommend ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
Dine Against Darkness was enlightening and the dining in total darkness in the back of Hal and Mal's  added so much to the strength of the message. And the dark 3 course meal was delicious.
Great food, wonderful service, and in the evenings usually a nice little band or duo playing live music.  I highly recommend it.
Good food and great decor. Friendly and attentive staff. Many local beers to choose from but the tap down for maintenance. Still a great place to eat, drink, while enjoying live music.

name: Sherria’s Chicken Coop 2Go
address: 1505 University Blvd Suite G Suite G, Jackson, MS 39204, USA
reviews: This was the best smoked chicken and baked beans I’ve ever had that chicken will make you slap your mother and your Grandma. The Olive Branch Chicken Coop has delicious food that is consistently good. Usually I bring the wings home, but one time I ate there and I started to notice how badly the restaurant was kept up. It is uncomfortably hot and you will smell like fried food when you leave due to poor ventilation (this is normal for small restaurants that fry their food - not picking on this place). I was the only one who sat there and ate. I think the 2 guys working there were embarrassed b/c they started cleaning around me.
This was delicious.  I enjoyed every drop.

The Olive Branch Chicken Coop has delicious food that is consistently good. Usually I bring the wings home, but one time I ate there and I started to notice how badly the restaurant was kept up. It is uncomfortably hot and you will smell like fried food when you leave due to poor ventilation (this is normal for small restaurants that fry their food - not picking on this place). I was the only one who sat there and ate. I think the 2 guys working there were embarrassed b/c they started cleaning around me. They are so used to everyone picking up their food to take home that when I sat down to eat, they became a little uncomfortable. Anyway, the only reason I didn't give them 5 stars is because of the state of the restaurant - the food is worth 5 stars.
As always I need my nap now.
Great food at affordable prices. The strawberry cake is so delicious!

name: The Pizza Shack
address: 925 E Fortification St, Jackson, MS 39202, USA
reviews: Downtown on Fortification Street is mostly a “take away” location. Second location in Madison, MS off I-55 North. In a small strip mall. Never eaten at Downtown location. Pizza is good. Crust is good. Serves ice cream and a few sandwiches. Pizza joints are notorious for bad service. Not the Madison location. Pizza is like BBQ. Served different in all regions of the USA. Pizza Shack has really thick crust and piled high toppings. Sauce is good. But the paper papers need to end. Nothing special about the dining area. Small patio is good. All pizzas are unique. Local favorite.

The food is great. It's filling and they pile the food onto the pizza as well as everything else is decked down with the ingredients. They are opening a new pizza shack in pearl, MS. On hwy 80 by the harbor freight.

Pizza is good. Crust is good. Serves ice cream and a few sandwiches. Pizza joints are notorious for bad service. Not the Madison location. Pizza is like BBQ. Served different in all regions of the USA. Pizza Shack has really thick crust and piled high toppings. Sauce is good. But the paper papers need to end. Nothing special about the dining area. Small patio is good. All pizzas are unique. Local favorite.
Really tasty! I had the Italian cowboy and it was delightful. Crust was thin and crispy?

I specifically asked that my supreme pizza be "burnt" as I like a well done pizza....it was not.  And the chicken wings were not cooked thoroughly either.  The only highlight was the cheese sticks.  Also, they sell Pepsi products....I prefer coke.

name: Country Fisherman
reviews: I absolutely love this place. When my hosts brought me here for the first time, I fell in love. Super busy!!! The staff is very attentive and the food tastes soooo good! Great southern cuisines that I grew up with. No complaints here. We drove around looking for someplace to eat lunch and found this gem of a place. It was a buffet which had several types of food, chicken, fish, BBQ and so much more. The waitress was excellent and very friendly.
Had the catfish it’s great, chicken was good, was hoping for green beans and soup beans and mash potatoes but they didn’t have any of that. Service was 5 stars for sure! Super nice people here!

I have eaten here I know for over 20 years and have always pushed anyone I knew to go but no more... partially now because I am vegan, my tastes have changed a bit but the last 3 times I've been here the food has NOT been good. It's not properly seasoned and it's always over cooked. And the fillings for the deserts have a metallic taste. Maybe at some point if my stomach is forgiving I will give them another try. When or if that time comes, I hope the food and my opinion will be better.🤮👎
Food was delicious.  Worth the cost.

My group of 35 had planned to stop at national chain buffet restaurant. We called ahead for service. When we arrived we found out that it would be and extended wait for a group of hungry individuals. We decided to leave. We went to another national country store/restaurant. Another extended wait. Two ladies were standing near the entrance. I asked them for a recommendation of a buffet restaurant for a large group. They both quickly agreed on the Country Fisherman on Highway 80 in Jackson (MS). We got back on our bus, I called ahead and told them we were 15 minutes away and wanted to know if they could accommodate us. The receptionist immediately told us yes they could.

name: Thai Time Thai and Sushi Restaurant
address: 1405 Old Square Rd, Jackson, MS 39211, USA
reviews: Posted on behalf of Ms. Banks, who does not have a google account.— “Yesterday at Thai Time Thai and Sushi Restaurant, I had a very disturbing experience that was very unprofessional, unsettling, disheartening and embarrassing to say the least. After purchasing three to-go orders and one to-go buffet around lunch-time, as I frequently do, (spending over $40). As I waited for my to-go entrees after already paying and fixing the to-go buffet plate, an employee—both a man and woman, approached me mentioning something about the buffet.  I did not clearly understand exactly what they were saying at first, but the lady then said that someone from the kitchen said that I put something in my mouth while at the buffet. Appalled at this accusation, I immediately, calmly told her that did not occur, in fact, I had chewing gum in my mouth at the time! Yes, she apologized, but the damage had already been done. It makes me wonder that if I had been a different person, or looked a different way would I have been approached, accused and humiliated in such a manner. I have decided that I will not patronize a business that thinks so little of me, to think that I have not the least of manners and would stand at a public buffet at a restaurant and put food into my mouth. I started to request a refund, but I had already decided that it would be the last penny that they would ever get from me.  It is so unfortunate that this type of establishment is even present in our city of Jackson, MS”
Buffet is small, but everything was flavorful and delicious, cheap and affordable too! If you want a Thai buffet, definitely give this place a try.

Possibly the best Thai food in Jackson. My coworkers and I always visit here when ever we visit Jackson. You honestly can't go wrong with anything on the menu. A personal favorite of mine is the Crunchy Chicken! Thai Time was fantastic! We shared the vegi egg rolls and Boom Boom Shrimp, that tastes a lot like Bonefish's shrimp. Delicious. Also, the Yellow Curry Chicken was fantastic. My six-year old nephew loved it and he's a picky eater. He ate some just after coming from hibachi, which he loves. That's how great this place is. The server was great and management too. My favorite Thai restaurant in the South so far.

We drove there from Memphis, TN as part of a road trip.  We have visited Thai restaurants in Nashville, TN and Little Rock, AR already.  I have never been to Jackson so it’s time for a road trip.  We ordered shrimp Pad Thai, shrimp basil fried rice, som tum, grilled chicken, sticky rice and one more basil fried rice to go.  We didn’t order any dessert just two drinks.  The bill came to $83 with tip.  The food was not bad but the price was too high.  I didn’t like the way they cooked the basil fried rice neither.  The portion of the food for this price tags only lasted for two meals, I thought that was outrageous.  The Thai waitress knew us from a Thai restaurant in Springfield, MO and she made a rude comment in the kitchen about me and my husband by thinking that I could not hear her.  I do not appreciate that.  I will not return to this place again.  I rather visit PF chang in Memphis which costs less and has better food than going back to this place.

Look, I am a steak and potato guy, but this restaurant is great.  A little help, but I picked the fried rice and shrimp-#1 for spice level. Delicious!!!! A gem that is hidden and the service was great...clean too.

name: Dave's Triple B Restaurant
reviews: Fantastic food. High quality meat and wholesome food. Never a disappointment! Always good eatin'!
Absolutely amazing food and friendly staff. Truly great Big Rhonda Challenge. Can’t wait to try it!

The herbs, seasoning, the ratio of fat used in the meatloaf was perfect, not one dry bite! I've never been a fan of bbq sauce on my meatloaf or bbq sauce at all, so I'm glad to see that it's more of a tomato base sauce, more sweet than tangy. My green beans were fine, not much taste, same with the mac n cheese. The cheese had a slightly grainy nutty texture, which I find to be strangely addictive! I love my mac n cheese that way, not too much taste, not overwhelming in cheese, just nicely coated. The meatloaf has a lot of taste, so I thought pairing it with the green beans and mac n cheese kept it the star of the dish.

Stupid good burger. Maybe the best burger on Earth. Limited hours, but quick service. We walked through the door at 12:30 and had our food at our table by 12:40. The restaurant doesn't look like much from the outside, but inside it's clean and modern. Eat a Wagyu burger with Swiss and mushrooms when you're ready to change your life.

Excellent food, beautifully plated!

The building may look like it used to when it was that cafeteria-style BBQ place, but the menu and "vibe" are much better. I definitely like the changes!

The meatloaf "Blue-plate special" looked as beautiful as the pictures on this website and it tasted even better than it looked. We also tried the Wagyu beef and a sandwich. All were delicious.

name: Aplos Simple Medierranean
address: 4500 Interstate 55 North, Suite 174, Jackson, MS 39211, USA
reviews: Love this place..Don't know why I didn't know about it sooner..The wings are different and delicious.. Rotisserie chicken is some of the best around.    The Rotisserie special is a great deal and fulfilling.. Juicy all the way through.. Greek fries are awesome.. pizzas  are  awesome...dishes are put together nicely with their own special touch...Great food...Headed back to try out the salads.. Definitely worth the stop if u love Mediterranean..

Alpos is the bomb and pet friendly. Excellent service.  When the kitchen backs up, they stop taking orders. Not a problem here. It's worth the wait. Sit on the patio or visit the area shops until they start taking orders again. Usually last for about 10 minutes.

You get great Mediterranean food here. I little pricey but wasn't disappointed. My daughter said the hummus was the best she has ever tasted. The Gyro pizza is also recommended. Friendly staff made the whole experience memorable, wish we could afford to eat there every week!

Love this place so much!  The Greek wings and creamy feta dipping sauce is AMAZING. The wine and beer selection is great, too.  The fact that it has a bright and airy atmosphere INSIDE along with an option to eat on the cheerful terrace with the Highland Village fountains makes it a fantastic place to eat all year round.  They also have a killer happy hour! Frose all around!

Beautiful location for a casual date night. Really wanted to try the frosè but they were out! The sweet waiter had me try something else! That was so kind of him!  So got the frozen blood orange drink.......it was divine. I got the lamb wrap filled with tender juicy lamb and fresh vegetables on a pita bread. My husband tried the chicken pizza and was good too. Great staff, cute location, delicious food, and divine drinks. We both had a good time together. Definitely going back!

name: Crechale's
reviews: We ate Valentine's dinner at Crechale's. Fortunately, little has changed. Still USDA Prime steaks and fresh seafood, fried or broiled. We love the broiled scallops in a white wine butter sauce. I add a little fresh lemon and it is seafood heaven. If you want to have a selection of seafood, the seafood platter is available broiled or fried. The steaks are basically plain grilled prime steaks. Prime steaks are well marbled and need little seasoning beyond salt and pepper and maybe a little butter. There are other restaurants for marinated choice steaks and elaborate sauces and toppings. Our eleven year old said that the scallops were delicious.
Fresh flounder,  5 star service,  Bob on deck.

Had not been here since the 1990's so I was back in town for a wedding & thought I'd give it a try. Still so GOOD! Nothing had changed since I was there. Same jukebox with the same great country music, same curtains, & the best part was the same great food. Staff very attentive for sure. I had the scallops. Couldn't believe they gave me twelve!! Had double salad rather than a baked potato with the wonderful comeback sauce. Could just about drink it through a straw. Love it!! Next time, I won't wait so long to go back!!!

grew up in Jackson and I first started eating there in the middle 70's.I have since moved to Nashville but when I came home for Christmas I made a special point to dine there again because I had such fond memories of it in the past. I was delighted to see that nothing had changed a bit since the 70's and I doubt since 1956. It is such an iconic example of a business model that was done right and continues to be done right. It is Saturday night and I have no doubt there is a line forming outside their door as I type this
Old school food and atmosphere. Don't go here expecting a light meal or vegetarian options. Go here for a birthday and get the onion rings.

name: Fred's Soul Food Restaurant
reviews: I had business venture in the area. Found some time for breakfast and did a review on top breakfasts. Thanks for some quick research and I ended up here. Wow what a delight. Lots of choices personally I ate the fried chicken, sausage and eggs. On my way out 4 cooks were sitting for coffee and chit chat. All very much like what I would define as grandma's. Now I know why the food was soo good. Cant beat the price and the hospitality. Many Thanks to the staff!
Pancakes..better than McDonald's..similar to taste of dairy queen pancakes..Salmon patties.....no onions, no peppers..must be bought ..cant prepared in-house. Great customer service thou!
Recent changes have made it more difficult to use Google maps. I prefer user friendly apps. I have found another app I prefer to use

I travel constantly over 25+ years several different Countries and half the United States. I found this place Bullys while pasding thru Westside Jackson Mississippi. Wow reeaaaly goood food. They have very good homestyle/southern style cooking, with several vegetables for sides. I highly recommend. This is a 'must' place to visit. Also they have Extremely sweeeet lemonade and tea (some people may understand what we call 'southern sweet' or 'ghetto sweet', so be cautious...its so good and sweet that you maybe could pour it on your pancakes !
I love that homestyle type of breakfast that Fred's offers!! Always fast n friendly great place for a good meal,will definitely be returning

name: Pearls Southern Cooking
reviews: If you're looking for southern soul foods, this is the place to go. The catfish and fried chicken are top notch and the green beans were so good, my friend had to go back for seconds (which she never does). The sweet tea tasted like summer and the entire staff was friendly and welcoming. I felt right at home.

The meals there started out good, after a while I noticed everything was heavily seasoned with SUGAR. I stopped purchasing take out from the buffet. I really did take a liking to her meats but when I asked for a special order and not the buffet it seems like it upset her. She rolled her eyes and was not polite at all. I have a family of 4 so I expect to pay hefty for what we enjoy but if its a bother, I will not return. Plus word of mouth goes a long way.

A little unknown place over on McDowell road Jackson Mississippi, wonderful food, good customer service, the place is due for some sprucing up, that will certainly make it more inviting. Sure would love to see that happen! The food is delicious 👌
Not much to choose from and the drinks are only water sweet and non sweet tea
