The best southern cooking i have had. Truckers there is parking . Come on down. Lunch buffet  with some great sweet tea 10 and change.. I marked it on my saved spots .. not fancy but the food is a 11 out of 10.

name: Farish Street Fish House
address: 526 N Farish St, Jackson, MS 39202, USA
reviews:
Friendly owner and staff.
Very clean.
Tasty food.
A must try if you are in the downtown area.
Delicious fresh food. Great customer service.
Great place great food.  I had the philly cheese steak I'll coming back.
This is an excellent place 2 purchase fish chicken or Shrimp every thing was excellent
He'd the catfish and the philly.  Pretty good.

name: Cultivation Food Hall
reviews: The Poke bowls are AMAZING! The tiramisu at the deli was the best I've had! My mom loved her bagel sandwich from the deli. Love this place. I'm going come all the time!

I was stoked to check this place out after seeing it on Instagram (@cultivationjxn). It surpassed expectations. The interiors were completely up to date and provided such a positive communal space for eating that had adequate seating selections for different size groups, making 8 people feel as comfortable as 2. There was a dining area separate of the main hall and was quieter if you wanted a calmer meal, but I recommend enjoying the atmosphere of where the vendors are. 

The choices of style of meal were superb and varied, not just BETWEEN vendors, but in vendors themselves. Each of the sub-shops had a great selection of menu items related to their “theme” but they were quite varied, bringing truth to the food hall’s name...every item felt cultivated. 

Aside from the wonderful food, there was a coffee shop serving fantastic brews, and a bar fully stocked with both alcohol and friendly staff. 

PRICE: TALK ABOUT WORTH IT. None of the food was in the least bit expensive or overpriced. I was actually quite shocked by how accessible the items here are, given the chic look of the establishment, but the quality is great and the service follows suit. Both still and sparkling water are available on tap (with actual glasses) for free, and empty plates are stocked aplenty around the joint for splitting or sharing meal items with others. 

Absolutely nothing but positive reviews on this place and everything it presents. Can’t wait to go back and try other items!
It was amazing. We ate at Local Honey and ordered the Avocado Toast. It was delicious and definitely recommend it! Check the pictures!

Great atmosphere, full of food counters with an eclectic selection of food styles to choose from. Pictured is a NY Lox "sandwich"from Ariella's NY Deli. It's an everything bagel with Nova Lox (salmon that's been cured and smoked and is thinly sliced when served), with tomato, red onion, capers and a "schmear" (thin layer) of cream cheese.
In NYC this would be known as a bagel all the way....
I will suggest to them, when I go again, that they toast the bagel, or at least offer it as an option... Bagels in NY are always offered to be toasted and are usually served that way.
Will edit post shortly with other pictures.

I like the idea of the food hall. It's essentially a food court on a higher scale. For a family with different tastes this is a nice option. We tried three different restaurants on our visit.  All three were very good. The crepes seemed to be everyone's favorite. It was not too crowded, especially for a Saturday night. Overall good experience, nice staff.

name: Steve's
address: 125 S Congress St, Jackson, MS 39201, USA
reviews: Get the lemon iced tea cake! So yummy.  Also, the guy who prepares the food seems super into his work,  which makes things even more interesting here. Quick preparation.  Nice menu of fresh eats.  Salads are freshly made. Go, try it. Cute spot.
Great food. The bread was to die for, a very unique taste!
Steve’s is just what you want for lunch...delicious soups, sandwiches, and lunch specials with great cookies too!
Absolute best lunch in Downtown Jackson
Wàs and still is a great lunch spot good food

name: Godfrey's
reviews: wait time might be a while but AMAZING food, and SO worth the value. call ahead! highly recommend the Rum & Bourbon wings

The food was great. The service was great. The atmosphere is great.  No complaints. The chef even came and introduced himself.  I highly recommend the coconut shrimp, the sticky ribs, and the jerk chicken rolls!! It was all DELICIOUS!!

This restaurant came up as a recommended choice. It was absolutely delightful. The atmosphere was calming, the service was good but the food was GREAT! I’ve never eaten authentic Caribbean food but this has to be it!!! Will be back for curry chicken since it’s only available Monday/Wednesday. Thanks guys for the experience.

Went here for lunch with my mom one day. So glad we did. The food is out-of-this-world good. I'm thinking about when is my next off day so I can go again! They give big lunch portions! My mom enjoyed the Jerk "Sticky" Ribs with collard greens, yams and sweet cornbread. I had the Bourbon and Rum Wings with a side of mixed lime beans and okra. You have to try this restaurant if you ever get the chance!!! You will not be disappointed!!!
Great Staff! Very flavorful food. I will be going again. The jerk chicken was great! Nice little atmosphere. Sort of pricey but I think the food is worth it.

name: Margaritas | Mexican Restaurant
address: 1625 E County Line Rd #120, Jackson, MS 39211, USA
reviews: Margaritas is home away from home. The staff is so kind. You're greeted with a smile as soon as you walk in the door. The food and margaritas are superb. The service is top notch. Best around town. They are always consistent. You won't be disappointed!

My spouse and I truly enjoyed ourselves this afternoon. We had a great waitress by the name of Mrs. Phine. She assured we had everything we needed and was very considerate. The food was great and the drinks 🍸 was the 💣... Definitely coming back ... Great Job...

I came to Margarita’s with my family today- the day after Christmas. I told the waiter to use a gift card ($25) first then use my debit card. I opened the gift card at the table. The waiter asked: “Are sure you got money?” I said excuse me. The waiter said: “Your card going to decline.” I asked for the manager. He said the manager is busy. I told him I didn’t care. I waited for the manager to come to the table. I expressed to the Manager that I felt a way for the waiter to say that before taking my payment. The manager stated he would talk to the waiter. I said can you at least take gratuity off of my ticket. The manager did; however, when I was walking out the manager tells me you not the only one who card declines. MY CARD NEVER DECLINED!!!  The manager said this in front of other customers. I told them that I would report it. I do not know what the waiter to ask me if I had money just because I wanted to use a gift card. I will never go back

We have been going to margaritas for over 20 years. And for all those 20 years, the food has been excellent. The service is excellent. This is hands down one of the best Mexican restaurants around. Make sure to get the queso with your chips and try the fajitas!

While the food is good the only exceptional service that I receive begins and ends at the hostess station. On another occasion as I made my order to go, hoping to escape the dine in "service", it still happens. Dealing with someone that will make it very obvious that they do not want to be there. I guess at the time, as the order was not for me, I did sympathize. As for the bar far be it from me to question the actual margaritas there. I do, however, find them lacking in the preparation of other mixed drinks. Well... in all honesty I've never had their margaritas anyway. For example the barkeep prepared me a gin and tonic... with seltzer water. Once again though the food is delicious

name: Spice Avenue
reviews: This place is so good. Lunch buffet is around $12. Definitely worth it. They bring out hot fresh bread, charred to perfection. The lunch buffet has an assortment of fresh veggies with a variety of curry dishes and grilled meats. Selection varies daily but the goat vindilu (sp?) and butter chicken are my favorites. Service is great and waiters are attentive. At lunch, I can easily get in and out of this place in 20 minutes. Usually no wait to be seated.

I ordered for LAMB Birani, they served with cold rice and rice was  cooked long before. The guy was telling me that they just cooked rice, a professional lier. He doesn’t know I eat rice every day 2-3 times last 27 years. When I give rice in mouth, I do understand when rice was cooked. 

However, the food was horrible in test, I didn’t eat and enjoy the food.
The biryani was definitely fake, this place is not authentic at all. Barely had a selection, and I definitely would not recommend to people who enjoy real Indian food. The food had zero flavor.

Pretty good vegetarian options for the lunch buffet here, but for meat there was only a couple chicken and one fish dish. Less options than some of the other Indian places in Jackson. Service people were nice.
I absolutely will return. Great food, Great atmosphere and exceptional service.

name: The Farmer's Table
reviews: What a fun little "bistro"! Perfect for a Saturday morning nosh. Hidden just inside the Farmer's Market there are tables in the lobby and a few in the bistro. Food was freshly prepared, tasty and served in human sized amounts. Excellent coffee. Recommend the Full Southern Breakfast and the Breakfast Burrito.

Seems to be more of a catering joint or more lively when the entire farmer's market is open. Absolutely dead when we went and the rest of the market was closed which makes for an intimidating and cofusing walk-in. Employees were prepping for other days and 2 of the 3 tables in the tiny space were taken up by them. Absolutely not a restaurant you can sit to enjoy breakfast at. It was like eating a breakfast burrito in someone's office. Food was okay.

This is a hidden gem for the locals working downtown, but it is also just off Hwy 55. The food is fresh and the vegetables are Southern but creative. For lunch, they have two or more choices for entrees, but it is so hard to choose from the delicious sides, I often just have a vegetable plate. As for crime, Jackson has it, but the downtown area is well patrolled and I have no problem going here by my senior self.

What can I say, they have the best grits and that bacon... delicious!
 Food 5 
Service 5
Atmosphere 5

I don’t write reviews; but, this place left such an overwhelmingly sour taste in my mouth, it was hard to taste the cooking. $32 for a bitter middle aged woman who can’t take responsibility for her own simple error behind the line. Been in service industry for several years and have never treated a customer with such attitude and poor social demeanor over what can be easily fixed. Time for a career change to “the owner”

name: El Centro Grill
reviews:
Wow Man, this place is great, I went there for Lunch and was immediately greeted and seated. The place had a hip and rustic vibe to it, which I really liked, The owner was very friendly and asked where I am originally from and placed an Indian flag at my table, which was such a nice gesture.
Food was served fast and tasted great, I was a nice experience I will definitely be returning soon. Will recommend to anyone looking for Mexican food in Jackson Downtown

You absolutely must try the Chicken Jalisico. After a long day, this was the rich hearty Mexican dish that I was craving. The place was a little empty for a Saturday night but that was certainly not a reflection of the quality of the food. The entire table was extremely satisfied with our orders. Service was prompt and the staff very friendly.

Good food   great service and the first 
I tried a hookah (sp) pipe ! It was fun

Went here on lunch and it was absolutely amazing! Our food was delicious and the staff were as friendly as could be. They even tried to teach us how to use some instruments but we’re just terrible at music. Loved the experience, loved the food, 10/10 would recommend and come back again!

This restaurant was an excellent example of southern hospitality! The food was flavorful and absolutely delicious. The service was prompt. By far one of the best atmospheres (great photo opportunity).

name: Piccadilly
reviews: We stopped for lunch at Piccadilly, our first time and unfortunately, our last, because we were on a bus tour and live on the West Coast. The selection was outstanding. I ordered the fish almondine. The portion was huge, covered the whole plate. The price was $9.99 and included two sides, and a wonderful selection of breads plus drink. If I lived closer, this would be one of my favorite places. Tasty, fresh and reasonably priced.
Breakfast was much better this time.  The staff was very helpful & friendly.  Would have given 5 stars, but if you're 45 minutes from closing, don't say you won't be making anything else.

I sent my friends to this restaurant with my highest recommendations. I visit this restaurant often. I get very good feedback from my friends. The the cooking is appetizing and the crew is generous and cooperative. always when we go to this place we enjoy a splendid time.  warmly recommended.

If you like Southern "comfort food," then you'll probably like this cafeteria-style dining experience. The serving line and dining room have recently been remodeled, with new tables and chairs. Some partitions were removed, giving the room a more open feeling. Serving-line staff now wear white tunics, giving then a more upscale look. There is a room which can be reserved for private gatherings. Previously, it was defined by accordian partitions. Now, it is entirely glass enclosed. I like the seafood gumbo!

Baltimore approves! Shout out to the sweet manager Mary and her pleasant, hardworking staff; Jackie, Romeo, Stephanie, Ted etc. Thank you for my experience. This is definitely my go to when I visit again. I rarely do breakfast or buffets for that matter but, I would make an exception here. The welcoming, the food, the meet and greets to make sure you have everything you need; this is definitely an experience and gem here Mississippi. Everything is fresh (fruits and veggies) you have your made to orders (omelets, pancakes, French toast and waffles), or your classic continental breakfast (,cereals, muffins and yogurts) all in all there's something here for everyone. I will be trying the lunch next visit. I highly recommend!

name: Bonsai Japanese Steak House
reviews: We had another perfect and flawless visit. Parking spots are a little tight for large vehicles and that was the only downside of the entire visit. We sat in the sushi area and ordered from the Hibachi grill. Food was prepared flawlessly and cooked to perfection. We were quickly seated and had no complaints about the food or staff. my Tea glass was kept full and they were very attentive.

Bonsai has and will always be the best place for sushi and hibachi. They knocked it out of the park tonight. Service was on point and the food was delicious. Cannot say enough good things. Good check them out

The food was excellent. We were there on lunch, so there wasn't much of a Hibachi show, which is normal for those crowded times. We also waited 20 minutes for each beverage refill, the waiter would simply disappear. Will be back for the food, hope the service gets better. Family and I had a great visit. Staff was very helpful and attentive. We sat in the booth area and ordered from the habatchi grill. Food was very good and just as we ordered. This is our favorite Japanese Steak house..
Hey All had a very nice dinner  at Bonsai Japanese restaurant  A new experience  For Me and wow it was  awesome  Great Meal.
Fun lunch!  Delicious hibachi chicken and rice. Water and tea stayed full and had leftovers for dinner.

name: Fine & Dandy
address: 100 District Blvd E, Jackson, MS 39211, USA
reviews:
One word: OBSESSED!

Hands down, my new favorite of all favorite spots in Jackson, MS. Fine & Dandy has stolen my heart, and I'll never be the same! The views, the decor, the Golden Hour menu, the service w/southern hospitality, and my Lord-- the food is amazing!

Hubs and I stopped for lunch, tried as much as we could possibly stomach, and loved it all. The Purist & Grandma Chick are manna from heaven! The meats are cooked to perfection and the fries are legit. I wanted more (softer, maybe some sweet or sourdough action) from the buns they serve, but I can deal. Not a deal breaker at all.

The also love the attention to detail here. It's as if nothing-- absolutely nothing was an afterthought, down to the check presentation, staff uniforms, and restroom wallpaper. (I love that ish)

Hats off to the chef & design team! I'm #FangirlingHARD and super impressed!

The menu is a limited but the quality of the food is excellent. The burgers are succulent, fresh and a perfect portion. The cocktails and milkshakes are excellent. I highly recommend the hot toddy - got rid of my cold which was an added bonus The tater tots with white truffle and trout caviar are interesting but the dill is overpowering. The katsu burger whilst different could pack a bigger punch

We had a great ‘date night’ at this restaurant.  The food was delicious, service was courteous,  and the menu was the best one I have ever read.   We tried a new beer, and some wine though they specialize in far more complicated mixes.  We tried the baked cheese appetizer ....  yum!   the chicken and wafflez (like no other!).  And the dinner special which was a snapper plate.  All dishes had very unique flavor and served on dandy china plates.  We were pleased to spend our evening here.  
The atmosphere inside is hip and spaced close together.  We chose to sit outside on the  porch where there are outdoor couches with short tables which  provide a quieter experience where private conversations could be had in any weather.  These couches are also great for families with kids - Plenty of room for movement.  
If you like this review, tap the thumbs up.

I was pleased to have the District at Eastover develop in the last few years as it is just a short car ride away from my home. One thing that sets them apart from the other restaurants in this area is service! I have always been very pleased with each and every one of the people who have served me during my many visits to this wonderful establishment. Now to the food.... (and drinks). When it comes to appetizers, you really cannot go wrong: Dad Bod tots, regular tots, Fries (it is served with Mayo, so if that's not your thing, ask for ketchup), and the pimento cheese is fantastic.

Food was basic after hours type food. Everything we had was good but did have rather long ticket times, especially considering it wasn't busy. Server was very mediocre - more like an order taker at a fast food joint. Atmosphere was very pleasant. Not too loud, not too quiet. This was my first time there and would most likely visit again next time in the Jackson area.

name: Broad Street Baking Company & Cafe
address: 4465 I-55 N Suite #101 Banner Hall, Jackson, MS 39206, USA
reviews:
My first time here and I will be coming back with friends !  Gluten free options and I ordered something not realizing it might contain gluten, the server informed me of the possibility and offered to let me order another side.  Wonderful customer service.  Everything tasted so fresh and original.  Loved the chicken wrap.  Loaded with chicken and black beans.   
The tea fresh and awesome coffee. Plenty of room for seating.  Area was clean.  The tables were constantly being cleaned up as soon as someone left.    Bakery products look delish !

We have loved to stop at this bakery and independent book store for many years as we pass through Jackson, Mississippi. Yummy fresh baked goods, breads, cookies, pastries, sandwiches, soups. We had the grilled cheese Panini and avocado toast. We bought cheese cake, bread, cookies to go home. It’s always worth a stop and a great place to catch up on work and take a break. Spacious, light and bright. My friend is an avid reader and he loves the bookstore upstairs and says there are all kinds of things he never sees elsewhere.

We decided to stop here while driving through Jackson for breakfast. The service was fast, staff was very kind, welcoming, and helpful. The food was amazing!! I had a breakfast quiche, which I've never seen served before. They also had a great selection of desserts and coffee. It's a great place if you like books. Lemuria,  cozy bookstore, is on the second floor! Would absolutely come back again.

Stopped here for the bookstore nearby, found myself lured to this restaurant (by the wonderful smells). With the amazing displays of baked goods and delicious food I will definitely want to come back. The staff were super friendly and my food was ready within minutes!

I was invited here for my birthday, and I loved it. I never knew it existed. Haha. I saw it a few days later rolling through I-55, and I was like wow that looks like a bank from the old days. I got the po boy catfish with Gumbo soup. It's a very wonderful place and the people are lively. Thank you Broad Street for a cool birthday lunch.

name: Basil's Downtown
address: 120 N Congress St, Jackson, MS 39201, USA
reviews: I highly recommend this jewel. I ordered the crabcake  salad with comeback sauce, ranch and the champagne vinaigrette. It was strongly suggested by an employee, along with the champagne vinaigrette. It did not disappoint. Huge serving enough for 2 days. Crabcakes warm and flavorful, the croutons were so large I thought they were grilled  chicken bits. Staff friendly and knowledgeable about what they are serving. Restaurant clean. Parking a bit of a challenge. Major let down. The restaurant downtown closes at 2:30 on weekdays. Not open on the weekends. Enjoy!

Food was freshly prepared, service was great and staff was friendly, some of the options in the menu were not available, that made us a bit disappointed but besides that other things were great, will visit again

We were in Downtown Jackson, Mississippi today riding around and looking for somewhere to eat that we had never been to, well Basil's Downtown was where we ended up, and I am glad we did... We didn't read the hours on the door when we walked in,  we  just went in and walked up to the counter, well it turns out they close at 2 p.m. and it was 1:55 when we walked in. We  honestly would have went somewhere else if we had known it was their closing time, but no one at the counter mentioned it, and they patiently answered all of our questions about items on the menu until we made up our minds.
   I ended up ordering the daily special, which was a Prime Rib Sandwich with Gravy for dipping, and I also ordered a cup of their Corn & Crab Chowder. When my meal arrived at our table a little while later, of course the 1st thing I tried was the Corn & Crab Chowder, and there was no disappointment there, as it was really good,  so of course I moved on to my sandwich, which I immediately dunked in the gravy, now this is where things all of the sudden had a WOW factor, as the gravy was by and far the star of the show, with the hint of wine not only being an unexpected surprise, but also making it one of the best gravies that I have ever had in a restaurant. I cannot lie, I liked the gravy so much that after finishing  my sandwich and seeing that there was still 1/2 a bowl of gravy left, I just grabbed my soup spoon and finished it off like it was a soup.... Not only was the food great here, the service was too, as we were not rushed, nor made to feel like we were inconveniencing the staff, and actually it was the exact opposite, as they were not only attentive, but also very friendly... I may not be in Jackson very often, but Basil's will now be one of my goto restaurants when I am...
The veggie sandwich on focaccia is excellent!
Delicious food friendly and hospitable service

name: Twin Peaks Restaurant
address: 6010 Interstate 55 North Frontage Rd, Jackson, MS 39211, USA
reviews: I eat lunch here quite a bit. My favorite appetizer is the 6 piece boneless wings with the spicy thai chili seasoning with ranch dressing and fries. They have a limited menu but this is by far my favorite dish. The beer here is probably the coldest in Jackson and prices are very reasonable. The wait staff are on point and eager to serve. I couldn't afford a trip to the beach this summer so bikini week at Twin Peaks has been a little blessing. Praise the Lord and pass the cold beer

Service was good but not spectacular. They were busy at the time so that could of had something to do with it. Saints game was on so that was cool. Lots of loud fans however which I get. Food was good. Had the pot roast which was very filling and felt home made.

My girlfriend and I decided to come to Twin Peaks for the first time and we left with a 5 star experience. We sat at the bar and we could not help but to acknowledge how much the blonde bartender was passionate about making sure the guest, including ourselves, were took care of and left happy. We asked for her name when we were tabbing out and she told us her name was Shell. She asked if everything was okay and we told her we wanted her to know how we very appreciative of her making sure we left happy. We want to give these 5 stars to her and let her know we will be coming regularly because of the experience she gave us.

Kristi is the best bartender I have ever got the pleasure of having make my drinks.  The service and skill that she provides is unmatched.   Sierra and Kristi make a great team. They will keep you with a smile on your face the whole time you're there.  I highly recommend going to see them!!!
Atmosphere was nice but they lost my order and I had to wait almost an hour and a half for my food..

name: Sankofa Kitchen Of Jackson
reviews: We ordered confitduck wings, brisket hand pies and a small veggie pizza and every dish was outstanding. Their Bourbon collection is the best we’ve ever seen, and the wine list was varied and interesting. One of the owners stopped by our table and told us a bit of the restaurant’s history, which was a nice bonus. A lovely meal and evening! We stopped here for Sunday brunch and the chicken and waffles were excellent. Although it was crowded the service was fast and friendly.
Great friendly atmosphere!  Authentic Southern Traditional and Caribbean cuisine!

Got my usual order of double rice&beans and plantains.  My rice order was CLEARLY not a double order and the plantains were black, like they had been reheated several times.  They would typically give me this order in a carry out container but this time, it was in 3 separate containers.  This alone wasn't an issue so I asked if my order could be bagged.  I was simply handed a bag.  The entire experience today was not good.
Great customer service and AWESOME food!!
Great place very nice employees delicious food.

name: Picante's Grill
address: 960 N State St, Jackson, MS 39202, USA
reviews: Great food, inexpensive, the owner and employee s come you feel like family. When ever your at a place where the owner comes out talk and will set down with like he grew up with up. This place is a keeper and yes you find some healthy thing on the menu 😉😁😁 thanks for being awesome business 👍👍 😊

This place is my favorite Mexican restaurant in the area.  I've been here many times and the food always tastes the same, delicious. The eating area is always clean and the bathrooms are generally clean as well. My food has always been ready in under 10 mins.  My only complaint is the service. The best waitress is Gerardo. The  service from other servers is not always the best. After they bring your plate, they don't come back to your table. Always request to sit in Gerardo's section.

The fajitas picante was the best. It arrived with chorizo, shrimp, steak, and chicken. It was wonderful. More than enough to fill one person up.I love their salsa. It tasted very fresh and I love the amount of lime in it. My favorite. And the best, was is the paprika on the table. Everyone should put it on everything.
Food is served quickly and is a good price.  Service is good.  Would be nice if there was a little better parking.

It's a shame when a restaurant has good food, but customer service ruins your experience. Came here to meet with some sorority sisters after a funeral. And was given not the best customer service. Server was very short, and would just walk off while you were talking to her. Our food came out at all kind of crazy times, no napkins were given although asked many times.  I honestly don't think I would return here.

name: Zoe's Restaurant
address: 5350 N State St, Jackson, MS 39206, USA
reviews: I have waited 2 hours for my food. The first and the last time going there, never again. The food was not good and plus my food was cold. I have never waited for my food for that long. I have ordered a grilled chicken salad and they put way too much bacon on it. It was too much..
Some of the best food around with many different options.
Yes Ma'am Pam honey! I enjoyed the service, quality, and quantity of my food andexperience! I felt like Whitney Houston after my first taste. I have nothing!!! Keep up the great work! God bless‼
Man!!!! Everything on the menu is AWESOME!! Brought my sil and she fell in love!!!
Easily one of the best and most underrated spots in Jackson. The food was great and the service was even better!!! I'd spend money with them any day.

name: Piccadilly Restaurants
address: 350 W Woodrow Wilson Ave, Jackson, MS 39213, USA
reviews: We love to go to the location in Jackson, MS, on I-55 frontage road. Jackie Wiggins seems to always be there to greet us with a smile and give us extraordinary service. We are happy to go there just to see Jackie. She knows what we want when we arrive, and get our omelets going. It is just a pleasure to enjoy the wonderful food and our visit with Jackie. She makes our experiences special!

The Food was delicious and filling! Excellent Management, cooks, and serving/wait staff! I brought our Senior citizens to Jackson, MS for a Cultural Arts tour. We were treated like royalty by Mrs. Kisha at this Piccadilly!

Never ate at a Piccadilly before. The. Choices are overwhelming. Good thing is you have to go past all of the offerings before you get your tray. We hit this right at rush time so there was a line but it went quickly. Some of the food could have been warmer. Just had the vegetables for lunch. Broccoli and lima beans but both were good. Lots of choices.

The pork loin was fork tender, not greasy at all. The food servers were polite & helpful as was the cashier. The young man working the dining carried my tray (I had bags & jackets over my arms). He  appeared to be working the entire dining room by himself. He had a cheerful countenance & did his job well even as stretched as he appeared to be.
A great family environment. The children also enjoy the food and fellowship here😋
